Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 199SeasonedTraveller
Reviews.Content: A very good suite hotel. great rooms and location. Ideal for Sea world and International Drive. Just a short drive to the Disney Parks. Only downside no in room safe. Not very convenient to have security boxes located at main reception. Facilities in very local area growing all the time. Fridays restaurant and Cvs Pharmacy already there. Walgreens just across the road with other units being built.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ExeterGemini
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10 nights as its a Virgin Holidays Hotel. The hotel itself is quite new and it shows. The suites are a good size well appointed and comfortable. Nice large screen TV, microwave oven and a nice sized useful fridge. A coffee maker was supplied as well. The toilet is separate from the main bathroom which was quite useful. The bathroom was well appointed and the shower was good. The only thing I think that was missing was an in room safe but there was a deposit box at the reception that you could use. The bed was a queen size and we had 2 of them in the room and still plenty of room. The free WiFi was great and it was nice to see that a wired connection was supplied as well. The breakfast supplied was sufficient and the dining area was comfortable although it did get busy. The location was good for either drivers or non drivers as the I Drive bus stop was right outside the hotel and being a SeaworldOrlando Hotel transportation to the Seaworld parks was laid on. There were a couple of places to eat within walking distance and as a guide a cab to Universal studios city walk was $25.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, stylish hotel at SeaWorld's doorstep.”
Reviews.Author: LadyTripTaker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a Marriott Award (forgot I had so many Marriott points...had been staying at Hiltons so often). Wow, this was a fantastic hotel. We checked in very late. The woman on duty was fantastic (quick painless chech in). The outside of the hotel and the lobby were beautiful. This hotel has to be rather new...very clean. The best rate I saw on-line for the particular night we stayed would have be a AAA rate fro around $169.00...but I got it for free (excellent hotel to use points on)...a lot of points go a long way here. The room was beautifully decorated (for some reason, we got the handicapped suite (which was fine and very spacious. The room had two Queen sized beds, couch, chair desk, and a nice flat screen tv. Very clean. Well, the reason I picked this hotel was because the pool area looked pretty good in the Trip Advisor photos (wanted a cheap, nice hotel...knew we'd be coming in very late and wanted to swim a little in the morning). It seemed to have a little extra with the whale tail and penguins that sprayed in the pool....was cute and my daughter loved it. The pool area was very nice and clean. Water was warm. The pool area seemed to be shared with another Marriott that was located right next door. The free breakfast was okay (nothing spectacluar). However, the hotel was over-run with high school students on an over-night trip...no noise from them the night before, but they took over the entrie lobby during breakfast. That wasn't even too bad. I would definitely reccommend this hotel to others for visiting Orlando (good for a short stay of a day or two).

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: melski613
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after driving up from Tampa after visiting Busch Gardens. (Approx 1hr and 10 minutes from Busch Gardens.) Stayed here because we were also visiting Legoland (Approx 40 min away) and Universal (Approx 15 minutes from hotel.) This hotel is right around the corner from Sea World and in an excellent location. It has very easy access to all the near by attractions. The rooms were modern and clean. It was great to have the toilet and small vanity separate from the shower area. There was also an area with a pull out couch with desk and chair, microwave, and small refrigerator separated by a half wall and two queen beds. We were on the 5th floor and as my husband is a light sleeper are concerned about the noise level. The hotel was very quite and the beds were super comfortable. The free breakfast in the morning is a plus but get there early to avoid the crowd. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, well trained staff, no pool maintenance Easter Weekend”
Reviews.Author: goodeye2
Reviews.Content: Overall, for the value we paid, this hotel was an excellent choice. Traveling with 3 grandchildren our suite was just as represented and the buffet breakfast had variety. The staff was very helpful and craft activities were provided on Easter Weekend. The only drawback was the pool area on Sat and Sun was not cleaned. Pool and hot tub had dirt, swizzle sticks and limes from drinks littered the pool area and made it less than desirable. On Monday AM it was sparking clean. Housekeeping gets double stars for their excellent service in cleaning and bringing everything we asked for. I would recommend this hotel to others for the location, set up of suites and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT, quiet location with great views of Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: EdwardsFarnborough
Reviews.Content: Just back from our 1st trip to Orlando over the Easter holidays. Chose this hotel from its great reviews and were not disappointed. On arrival we were asked if we wanted a high or low floor. We also asked (if possible) could we have a view of Seaworld. Our room was great - on the 5th floor with the best view of the Kraken at Seaworld. Beds comfy - cleaned every day, separate toilet from bathroom ( no bath). Excellent breakfast included. Free shuttle bus to Seaworld and Aquatica and also free Quick Queue passes every day to Seaworld. Staff very helpful and friendly. Food served at the pool which was good and included Pizza Hut pizzas. All food could be taken back to your room if preferred. We had a car which was very handy - to get to Busch Gardens, Kennedy Space Centre and Universal. Parking is approx $14 a day at all the parks. Parking is free at the space centre. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if we return to Orlando would stay here again. Discovery Cove was the hi light of our holiday followed by the Serengeti Safari at Busch Gardens. It's a very hectic holiday - the first time we've ever had to set the alarm to get up on holiday - just that we didn't want to miss out on anything. The only minor (and I mean minor) disadvantage is that there are not many restaurants within walking distance to choose from. There is a great TGI Fridays which we ate at several times. As we had a car we used to eat on the way home from the parks or in the parks - so this was never a problem. If you don' t have a car the I Ride stop is by the hotel which you can get to travel up International Drive. Seaworld and Aquatica are minutes away. Universal was the busiest of the parks - Seaworld and Busch Gardens were our favourites (both not to be missed). We all had a great holiday - the hotel made it a 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, good location”
Reviews.Author: emk58141
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights over Easter weekend. (1 adult, 1 child). We got early check-in in a double bed room- exactly as I had asked. Starbucks in the lobby is a BIG plus, except be aware -it's not a "full" Starbucks- only one "coffee of the day", no tea lattes etc. That's not a complaint- just pointing it out. The young woman working the Starbucks was unfailingly polite & friendly. The room was comfortable & clean, except for the carpeting. It had quite a few BIG stains. I did not walk barefoot in the room because it was a bit skeevy. We slept very well though. Beds were very comfortable. Great blackout curtains. I would stay again (except we don't go to Orlando often) & would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “By good value”
Reviews.Author: Ning70
Reviews.Content: Great location and enjoyed the two nights we stayed here. The breakfast could offer ore but it's free. The rooms are very modern and the shower is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel near sea world”
Reviews.Author: wallace s
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful in many ways.. it is clean, the staff is friendly and extremely helpfful, and they provide transportation to sea world and to the water park. The rooms are very modern and extremely comfortable.. great pool for familes and childrenl.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Gary R
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during Easter weekend. The layout of the room was fine and functional. The reason for three stars was the slow water leak from the toilet area that would not go away.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: Owlguy00
Reviews.Content: I'm a teacher and I recently took at bus load of students and parents to Orlando. We stayed at this site and were very impressed. Beautiful, modern rooms! Defininately staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: xamyx16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 3/25-3/28 while we went to Disney World. My family has stayed at many Marriot properties, and I have to say this is one of the best I have been to! The hotel has a sort of sea theme to it (which makes sense since it's right by Seaworld). The lobby was nice and spacious, there was plenty of seating for the free breakfast in the morning. There was also an internet cafe, concierge desk, and it even had it's own Starbucks! The front desk was very welcoming (make sure to grab some Chupa Chup lollipops in the bowl by the desk by the way, they're good!). The room itself I thought was very nice. It also had a sea theme to it (lots of blues and greens). When you walked in, there was a sitting area with a couch that made out to a bed, as well as a small fridge and microwave off to the side. A desk and some frosted glass separated this area from the two beds on the other side. The other part of the room included the two beds, a dresser, flat screen tv, spacious closet, and two bathrooms! Although the two bathrooms weren't both full bathrooms (one was larger and had a shower and large vanity, the other was smaller and just included a toilet and small vanity) I thought it was great. Both bathrooms were separated by a sliding frosted glass door as well. It made it easier in the mornings to get ready with two bathrooms since we had three people staying in the room. Free breakfast was great in the mornings! There were lots of pastries, breads, fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon sometimes, and cereals. They had waffle makers, and even this quaker machine that made oatmeal. It was all the typical breakfast-y types of stuff, and I really couldn't say anything bad about it. They had a pool area that we never visited, but it seemed good! There was a bar there I believe where you could get snacks and drinks. I'm sure younger kids and adults would both enjoy this. I don't think we had any problems with the service. Everyone who worked there that we talked to seemed kind and friendly. The maids were outstanding! The rooms were always nice and clean, and we always got the extra towels we needed. One day our maid even made us a towel swan! The only thing I can sort of complain about in that area is that we went back to our room one day around 4:00 and the maid was still in the room cleaning, but I do understand that they have many rooms to clean in such a short amount of time, and it was really no big deal. Also, the drive for us to Disney was not bad at all. It really only took a good 5-10 minutes to actually get to the parks, so don't put this hotel out of the running for you just because it's a little farther away. And if you're going to Seaworld, this would be an excellent choice considering how close it really is. If you enjoy staying in the nicer part of Orlando, this is definitely the hotel for you. There was a CVS and TGI Fridays very close to the hotel, so if you need anything or just need somewhere to eat, it is very convenient. My only other complaint about our stay was that the beds were sort of uncomfortable. The pull out bed was apparently very springy, and the other two beds were not comfy in some areas. This wasn't such a big problem, and definitely doesn't affect whether we would come back or not, but I still think it's an issue. All in all, we would stay here again in a heartbeat! It's great that we've found another Marriot hotel to be able to book at when we are in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Clean Lines Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveller562
Reviews.Content: If you like sleek, clean-lines, modern type of hotel furnishings, then this is the place for you. After staying at four different Marriott properties in the very touristy Orlando area, I have finally found a place that I like. The rooms have a very modern feel, with light blues, greens, and browns. What I thought was especially clever, is that the commode is separate from the shower area. This is very helpful if you are travelling with a spouse or family. Each unit has a roomy closet, microwave, and a semi-separated desk area, separated from the sleeping space by a partion. The word "suite" is used a bit liberally, however, as the sitting area is rather small. It is essentially longer than a traditional hotel room, but still one room divided by a smoked glass partition. The pool area is very nice. The property shares a large, kidney shaped pool with its sister property, Fairfield Inn & Suites. There is also a whirlpool and "tiki-type" snack bar poolside. The exercise room is also shared, but was always vacant in the evenings. The exercise room was suprisingly crowded in the mornings, however. Breakfast was a little generic from a food perspective (but hey, its free!), and the breakfast area feels a bit crowded. It has an odd layout. The location of the property is very close to the Sea World parks and the hotel offers free transportation to said parks. There are several retail and restaurants very close by and a large Publix grocery store about 1/4 mile away. (There are sidewalks). My (very minor) complaints are that the elevators are slow, and on both my trips, one was always out of order, and the walls are a little bit thin. Of course, when your hotel is in a tourist area, there are alot of kids slamming doors and running down the halls. This happens pretty much anywhere in a resort area. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to business travellers, and families with 4 or fewer in the room. I think it would be a bit crowded for a family with higher numbers. Overall, I was very pleased with this property and would recommend it to both busin

Reviews.Title: “Hairy, sums it up”
Reviews.Author: dani322
Reviews.Content: Started off by calling the hotel for directions from Hollywood Studios. We were told to take I-4 west when it was actually east. Once we realized that the exit numbers were decreasing we took the first exit we could to turn around which was a huge mistake. It took us miles down the road before an exit was available, conveniently a toll road, to turn around. We called the hotel back and was told that depending how we left the theme park it could've been west. East is east! Once we finally reached the hotel I attempted to check in paying cash. Whenever you use a debit card they will place a 5-10 day hold for incidentals and I wanted to avoid that. I spoke to a clerk the day prior and was told that incidentals were "complimentary" which was confusing so I went ahead and took enough cash to cover it just in case. That's when Otis told me that I could not pay cash for the incidentals and they had to have the credit card. I explained to him that I had just left a Fairfield Inn and had no problem putting cash down on the room. He then explained that the Fairfield I stayed in was a franchise and not a real Marriott property, he also stated that they did not keep cash that late at night (11pm). At this point I was in no mood to argue and just wanted to get to my room. After checking in and taking a shower I proceeded to get into bed when I pulled down the sheets and found dirt and hair. I called front desk to inform them of this and was told that there was no one who could change the sheets and I could change rooms. Really had no choice at that point, so I re packed everything to move to a double room from the king I was hoping for. Once again I pull down the sheets to find more hair. Wanting nothing more than to check out and go elsewhere I call the reservation line to find another hotel. It's now after midnight so I would have to pay Friday rates and no guarantee I could check in at that time. So I call back to front desk and ask for new sheets to change the bed myself. After going through the first set because of more hair I finally found cleans ones. At 2 in the morning I'm finally settled into bed. Come 10 am I'm awoken to housekeeping entering my room even though I'm checking out that day. I call down to front desk and they reply that they will let the supervisor know. At this point I'm awake and ready to get out of there, I proceed to ask for the manager at check out when I'm told that she is in a meeting and I could speak to a supervisor, fine. Unfortunately the supervisor is not able to come speak to me and I must go next door to the Fairfield Inn to speak to him there. I explain to him everything that happened and he said he would pass it on, I specifically asked for the manager to call me. After three hours go by I attempt to call her to no avail. I left a voicemail on her direct line and have yet to hear back 4 days later. I'm not seeing the charge on my account so I am assuming they refunded the money but I'm not sure because no one has called or even sent an email recognizing the issues. This is the WORST customer service I have ever encountered. I will never again stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Momonthego08
Reviews.Content: Stayed Mar 23-25 for a little getaway. Have stayed at the Fairfield and now this hotel and both are fantastic. From the FD to Housekeeping to the breakfast girl to the barista at the Starbucks everyone was super nice! My kids love the pool and we enjoyed the Splash Grill (bar food plus adult beverages). Walking distance to CVS and a TGIFridays and directly across the street from SeaWorld. Room was spacious enough for two adults and 3 kids under the age of 12. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Carmen M
Reviews.Content: Its a good hotel neat swimming pools and very beautiful on the inside. We really liked it! Clean

Reviews.Title: “Lost wedding ring”
Reviews.Author: Mom24K
Reviews.Content: If anyone staying at this hotel on Monday March 19th found 2 Rings, 1 has inscription, please contact me. They were lost and likely found by someone in the lobby near hallway leading to the breakfast area or by the pool area between the hours of 10 am and 12:30 pm. I would like the wedding ring back for sentimental reasons. Please please email me if you found them or have any info. I am devasted and wouldn't even care if you kept the anniversary one if I got the wedding ring back. Email lesvarga@aol.com Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: GHal05
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our trip to Discovery Cove and Universal Studios. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Wonderful friendly helpful staff. The front desk was terrific. Great complimentary breakfast with so many choices. The decor in the entire hotel is modern, attractive, very welcoming, comfortable, yet allowed for privacy. The rooms were large and modern. Sitting area along with 2 rooms(bathroom/sink room and a shower/sink room). Also we walked to Discovery Cove-it was that close. Great Hotel/Wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way...”
Reviews.Author: abcjjl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights over President's Day Weekend. Arrived on a Friday evening around 8:30PM. Our check-in went smoothly Our party consisted of 2 parents and 3 sons. Boys all got blow pop suckers in the lobby, so they were good. We had a 2 queen bed room. The room was layed out very economically. It was not extremely wide from the left to the right but was fairly deep from the door to the outside wall. It had a small fridge and microwave. The bathroom set-up with the toilet and a small sink in one room with the tub/shower combo and a large sink area in a separate room was great for us. We found the beds to be very comfortable. The TV was a large, modern HD type. The couch area with the sofa bed was very nice for the kids to have a place to sit and watch the TV. The layout of the room was very functional in that it used the space in a very good manner. There was a decent sized closet. On the far outside wall was a dresser and an area to store luggage. For our 3 day stay, the room was great. There were a few nicks and scratches on some or the furniture. Some guests just don't seem to care how they treat other peoples' stuff. Also, housekeeping was very efficient we left notes for extra towels and had towels coming out of our ears. We did leave a $5 tip each day. That usually helps. The breakfast was well stocked. The scrambled eggs were the real variey as opposed to the powdered type that can be found at some breakfasts. There were several waffle makers. Their pastries and muffins were very good. The employees kept everything well-stocked and clean. It was a very nice breakfast that made getting out the door to the parks very easy. The only comment is that on Saturday and Sunday mornings they did not start serving until 7:00AM. The 6:30AM time that was employed on weekdays worked much better for us on Monday morning because the Disney parks were opening at 8:00AM due to the holiday crowds. Lastly, there were plenty of tables in the seating area. Sometimes it can be a nightmare finding a place to actually eat the breakfast at some hotels. The pool area is shared with the Fairfield Inn & Suites next door. It was very nicely themed. It was not crowded when we were there. A nice sized hot tub was enjoyed by our family on Saturday night. Plenty of parking. This property is located at the bottom of the International Drive hub so the traffic is not too bad. There is a TGIF's restaurant located in front of the lot of this facility and a Wendy's across the street. We were not visiting Sea World but it is located across the street from this hotel. Check-out was a breeze....our bill was left under our door. We paid $135 a night and thought that it was a bargain. We think that this was a wonderful place to stay. It took us a little less than 12 minutes to get to the parking lots of any of the 3 Disney parks that we visited. We usually stay at Disney hotels but refused to pay the ourrageous prices that they wanted for their moderate rooms. Compared to what we received and the amenities that Disney's moderates offered, the Spring Hill Suites were a no-brainer. We did have annual passes to Disney so our parking was not an extra charge. Great stay. A very high 5 stars from our family.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: traveler11999
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - not fancy per se, but modern and bright with blue & green water themed decor, which I assume is in honor of Seaworld right across the street. They have a nice free breakfast buffet, though it closes a little early for late risers. They have a nice pool with a bar and snack stand too. The location is great. The rooms are pretty, though the bathroom set up is a little odd in that they have frosted glass sliding doors, which don't feel as private especially when you're showering while others are sleeping. Overall a really nice hotel that feels very new!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Awesome property, very close to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: DaddyWhalen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of the Sea World vacation package, booked with tickets and a meal plan. The hotel was less than two minutes from Sea World, you can see to from all the tall attractions. Suite was very clean, with two beds and 1 sofa sleeper. Bathroom was split with the toilet separate from the vanity & shower. Very nice breakfast area in the morning, very clean with a huge selection, including waffles, eggs, bacon , cereal & yogurt. Pool was very nice, with a shallow Sea World themed kids end. Pool bar was cheap, with decent food. We will stay here again for our next Sea World trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Orlando Location Yet!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyschippy
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth visit to Orlando and we tried the Springhill Suites due to the brand, location and the fact that it was relatively new, and the hotel did not disappoint. Located on the corner of I-Drive and the Central Florida Parkway it's ideally placed for all the I-Drive resataurants and attractions, but far enough away to be quiet, Orlando International Airport and I-4, which is a couple of minutes drive away and makes it a short hop to WDW and Universal. The Hotel has a CVS and TGI Fridays right outside and a few chain restaurants in close proximity. The rooms are large and bright and easily accomodated two adults, two teens and a toddler. We found the microwave and fridge a great help with toddler feeding and the split bathroom/toilet was very handy at bedtime. The only problem I had with the bathroom and toilet was the glass doors, in a room which is likely to be shared, when the light was switched on in the night it disturbed the other occupants. There may be a logical reason for this, but I'll be jiggered if I can think of it. The rooms are kept clean and well stocked with towels and toiletries and the beds have good quality bedding and are very comfortable. The pool area, like the rest of the hotel, is very modern and clean with a bar which serves drinks and food. Breakfast was OK, but nothing special. There were hot options each morning which consisted of scrambled eggs, with a different meat, and waffles. Lots of cereals, yoghurts, fruits and juices were available. Seating could sometimes be at a premium as there was a school band and conference people there at the same time, but we managed. I do question the use of disposable plates and cutlery as they were poor quality and you tended to end up slicing through your plate when eating. Still, as I pointed out at the time, you don't get many hotels in Orlando that offer a breakfast free of charge. The staff were always on hand to offer a high chair and were always friendly. Reception was helpful to our needs and check in and check out was quick and easy. There is a small shop at reception which sells a few essentials. We also found the laundry handy and managed to wash and dry all our holiday clothes (fourteen days worth) for just a few dollars. I might be tempted to stay here again should we return to Orlando, but this much more pleasant section of I-Drive is getting a bit of development locally and maybe some more hotels may be built which will suit our needs should the teens to be old to travel with us next time, but if you're a family of four+ this hotel will fit your needs without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JLK41811
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, stylish and in excellent proximity to Sea World and Walt Disney World. I stayed at this hotel in January 2012. The hotel offers a free shuttle to Sea World for its guests. There is also a ticket and information desk located in the hotel lobby. Our room was clean and larger than I anticipated. I was traveling with an infant and was pleased that the room had a fridge and a microwave. I had requested a crib, which was a pack-in-play style that came with it's own crib sheet and was set up for us by the hotel employee. The toilet and a small sink is in a seperate bathroom from the bathroom with the shower and a sink. I found this to be conveinent while getting ready. The pool was wonderful, especially for young children. There are pool towels available nearby as well as a restroom with a changing station for babies. The only thing I was disappointed in was the hot breaskfast. Yes, it is free which is wonderful but the turkey sausage and eggs left much to be desired for. I opted for cereal, yogurt and fresh fruit that was available. There is also a Starbucks located inside the hotel lobby for coffee lovers. In walking distance across the parking lot is a TGI Fridays and a CVS pharmacy. We dined at Fridays a few times and CVS was wonderful to have so close to pick up any beverages or snacks for our room. There is a small pantry in the hotel lobby as well for drinks and snacks. We took a taxi to Disney World which took about 10 to 20 minutes to arrive. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. Staff was friendly, hotel was clean and in a great location to most parks. I would stay again if traveling in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrpc35
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 10 days at the Springhill. We usually stay a Disney but thought we would stay on I Drive for a change and visit the other parks and could not have picked a better hotel. Rooms were very nice we particularly liked the separate seating area which meant that we could relax and watch TV without the need to sit on the beds. Good location for visiting Seaworld either using the hotel shuttle or if not its only a stop away on the trolley system, a must if you stay there without transport like we did. The 14 day trolley pass worked out to be great value as we could travel the length of I Drive and visit both outlet malls and also use it to get to Pointe Orlando for an evening meal. There are dining options close to the hotel, one of our favourites was approximately 10 minutes easy stroll down the central Florida Parkway to a small area of shops including a Publix supermarket where Famas Italian restaurant and deli was situated, we'd had seen reviews from other travellers on this site. The restaurant serves excellent Italian fare including pizzas and pasta, all home made including cannolis for dessert. Michael at the Expedia desk in reception was very helpful in reserving places on the shuttle to Universal and also Busch Gardens which leaves from Seaworld and is free if you have tickets which cover both parks, we also spent a day at Aquatica was very close (in fact if there had been a footpath all the way there we would have walked there and back. There is also a CVS in the car park which is open 24 hours for snacks, wine etc. The staff at the hotel we all very friendly and always greeted us when we returned from a day out. Whilst we will return to Disney for our next trip to Florida we have already said that when we next decide to 'go outside the Mouse' we will not hesitate to stay at Springhill again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base for SeaWorld/Disney”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelCanada
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Springhill Suites met all expectations. We had a great deal that I booked as a vacation package through their affiliation with SeaWorld. The price was very reasonable and it included tickets for SeaWorld-I paid for two adults and received free tickets for the two children. I also based my decision on previous reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel was in a great location with a shuttle to SeaWorld. We didn't use the shuttle as we missed the first one and wanted to get there before the next one was due to pick up again. However, the drive was only about 2 minutes. The drive to Magic Kingdom was about 15 minutes. We arrived very early on the first day of our two day stay as we wanted to take advantage of the SeaWorld 'quick passes' available through the Expedia desk on a 'first come first serve' basis. We not only managed to get the passes, the front desk gave us access to our room and offered us breakfast! We were in our room 10 minutes and we had a call from the front desk to make sure everything was suitable. The room-2 queen beds, was clean (always a priority for me) and had lots of room for the kids to put their toys down and play in the sitting room off of the bedroom (or adults to sit and relax). The sitting room is not a separate area with a door to close it off, but that was not an issue. The breakfast was good-waffles, eggs,sausage and oatmeal as well as an assortment of cereals & toast options. The pool/hot tub area was very nice and the kids loved both. I would definately consider this hotel again if we go to any of the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate and Location”
Reviews.Author: mckenzi
Reviews.Content: Room is modern and spacious. We had two queen beds with a small sectional sleeper sofa. Little fridge and coffee maker. The window actually opens to the outside about 3inches.. I dont sleep well without fresh air! Breakfast Buffet was free, nice selection of Hot and Cold items.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: Salt_Water_Newfies
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a SeaWorld package which had great value (hotel, park passes, all day dining, and quick que passes). The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Free parking, wi-fi, and breakfast. The breakfast was great - eggs, sausage, cereal, toast, fruit, yogurt, oatmeal, waffles, etc. The breakfast staff was so fast at clearing tables. It could get busy during peaks time during the day, but we didn't have a problem getting one. They have laundry on-site - $2 for wash and dry. Pool and hot tub was great. The hotel provides a shuttle to Seaworld and Aquatica for free and comes frequently, just get a schedule from the lobby. It's less than 5 mins drive or a 10 min walk. It's right on International drive which you can use the I-trolley to go to all the main shopping areas. The hotel has a TGIF's, 24-hour pharmacy (you can get everything there, including beer, wine, etc), McDonalds, KFC, and Wendy's within 5 min walk. We did eat at the hotel restaurant (pizza hut and starbucks) which was pretty good. They have specials everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Worse experience ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen N
Reviews.Content: I would never recommend this hotel to anyone!!!! They are a complete bunch of idots and rip off artist. They must hire the most idiotic people. They have the worse customer service and bookkeeping employess I have ever experienced. Checked in for one night at this hotel used a card to sercure our room, checked out the next day and paid with a different card. Needless to say these crooks charged both of our cards and no refuse to give us back the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: jrmiranda
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice appointed hotel in Seaworld area. Huge suites and friendly staff. A bit expensive for the concept. Should improve quality of beds. I could stay again.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay again, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: moggey35
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for our second week in December and had come from a disney hotel. This was by far the nicer hotel. The rooms are huge and very clean. We liked the separate living area which was partitioned with a half wall from the bedroom. We had a great view across to Seaworld. The staff were so friendly and always spoke to you on your way into the hotel. There was a huge choice of breakfast in the mornings and everything was kept tidy throughout the stay. We got complimentary fast passes for Seaworld which was great and although we had hired a car, they did shuttle buses to various parks from right outside the front door. The pool was good and they had a bar next to it which served food to your room as well. There was a TGI Friday's across the road which you could also order from and get delivered to your room (with a small delivery fee). It had one of the most comfiest beds we have every slept on as well! We could not recommend this hotel enough to anyone wanting to stay here and in fact, we wished we have booked our whole 2 weeks with them.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rgiagurl
Reviews.Content: We first got a taste of this property, back when it first opened and started next door at Fairfield, when we checked in our debit card was messed up and would not process, so the property manager for both Springhill and Fairfield, checked us anyways, and sent a pizza to our room,knowing we had nothing until we could get our card fixed the next morning.....our next stay we switched it up to Springhill:) We learned about the hot breakfast they offered there. We travel to the area quite often and sometimes with 2-4 other families and always have 1-3 kids with us. The pool is great, and so are the daily specials at the poolside grill & pizza hut. We have stayed here about 7-9 times and this trip we actually are having to go elsewhere due to being last minute, I'm really dreading not staying at our favorite property in Orlando!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Terri D
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for a New Year's Eve visit to Sea World. I chose the location for easy driving to the park and was pleasantly surprised to find out the shuttle back and forth to the park ran very often, so no hassle driving on a busy night. The rooms are nice, I especially like the separate toliet room with sink. This was important for 3 adults getting ready the next morning, someone could shower while someone else could shave in the other "bathroom". The queen size beds were a bit soft for me, but my parents had no complaint about the firmness. The room only has a half wall separation between the sitting area and bedroom area so the TV on late at night still disturbed those in bed. There's a mini fridge and microwave, great for cold sodas and snacks. Breakfast the next morning included hot items like scrambled eggs and waffles. Definitely a nice place to stay for the location to Sea World and International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jocro22
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here 5 nights the week before Christmas and we did not want to leave. We paid $99 a night and got one night free. Very quick check-in and the staff are so friendly. None of the workers passed by without saying, "How are you?" The rooms are so spacious and modern. Everything is CLEAN. The pool area was great (bar, hot tub, heated pool). Free breakfast had a limited variety food but it's free so we can't complain. If you want quick passes, go to counter the day before you go to Sea World and get them -- they are well worth it. We used the seaworld bus everyday and they even have one that takes you to Universal so you don't have to pay for parking. CVS and TGIF are walking distance from the hotel which is very convenient. If the rates do not go up much, we will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Mirrasi
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised how mice this hotel was for the pricel. The staff was lovely and very professional. Our room easily slept 5 of us (2 doubles and a pull out couch) and we didn't feel cramped at all. Everything was very clean and nothing looked worn. I especially loved the shower with the extra shower heads for the body. This is a great place to stay if you plan to visit Sea World because you get complimentary quick queue passes. Although you should visit concierge at 7:00 am when they open because the tickets are on a first come, first serve basis and they can run out. On my first visit here (a holiday weekend), this happened. The hotel also comes with free breakfast which was wonderful because they had eggs and waffles. It can get quite busy though. We will definately be staying here often for our Sea World trips.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to have my group at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmanGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Well i am about to have my church group at this hotel in june. it seems like the hotel has a good location and has wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family visit to SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Want2gothere2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. It is in the same parking lot as Fairfield, but not on the main drag the way that Fairfield is. Our room was pretty quiet (except for the fireworks at SeaWorld, and those were pretty cool). Friendly front desk staff allowed us to check in early. The free shuttle does not travel all that often, but provides a clear schedule and was as accommodating as they could be. (And the hotel is pretty close to SeaWorld, so if you're in a bind, you can either take the I-Ride or a cab from the park if need be.) After a long day, my 3yo twins were not fit for dinner in public, so the TGI Fridays in the parking lot of the hotel will deliver to your room and charge it to your room. We love Spring Hill for the space and convenience for our family of four, and this hotel was extraordinarily convenient for our sightseeing/ exhausted family needs. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, huge rooms, and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Eman R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by someone who frequently visits the area, and was everything and more that I heard. Several of my colleagues also stayed at this hotel while we were all in town for a conference. The architecture is strange and refreshing (not the usual hotel interiors), the staff were super friendly, and the breakfast was great (with plenty of seating). The rooms were huge (and spotless)--I felt guilty being in a room by myself. Due to its proximity to Seaworld (literally across the street), it definitely is a family friendly place that probably has a huge amount of children during peak season. But, if traveling on business during off peak, this place is convenient to the Orlando Convention Center and will not disappoint, along with much better prices. Note that a car is desired (I was glad I had a rental car). Would definitely stay there again and recommend to anyone planning a trip in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Al G
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to Sea World, very nice hotel and friendly staff. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot, close to SeaWorld, fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tracyldale
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply excellent. This property shares its pool with a Fairfield Inn (which is near a busy street, the SpringHill Suites is on the non-busy end). There is a CVS and a TGI Friday's right next to them both. It's across from SeaWorld (essentially), so it's very close for everyone who's visiting this theme park area. From what I understand they have shuttles you can get reservations for to take you to these parks. We only stayed one night, three of us, in a 2-queen room. The toilet is separate (entirely) from the shower, so you have 2 sinks and 2 areas that can be closed off. This is ideal if you're with people you're not comfortable barging in on if they're in the shower and you have to use the restroom. The only complaint I had was that the walls were a little thin so we could hear some of the other people coming/going, and the bathroom doors are loud as they slide. Other than that, it's a well appointed room with everything we needed, including a nice couch which appeared to be set up to be another bed if required. The beds were firm but not too firm, very comfortable overall. The work space was also nice. Breakfast was sufficient - there is a Starbucks Lounge that is open for about 4 hours in the morning. The regular Lounge they state they have was closed while we were there. The pool bar we never tried, but did see some very happy patrons who came from it, and they seemed very pleased. We tried the pool/hot tub in the morning, before check-out, and it was very empty, which was a pleasant surprise. I would assume most folks were probably at SeaWorld already, so if you're not a park goer this might be an ideal spot for you if you want to sun all day. If you bring your car, you'll need a parking pass (they will supply), which is good considering the location. The area is well lit, and we did notice a Sheriff's car during our stay (parked). Overall, fantastic, and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice at SeaWorld”
Reviews.Author: Coach5000
Reviews.Content: Although the location of this property is great for anyone visiting SeaWorld, I stay at this hotel when I travel for business because it is newer, clean and the staff is very professional. The SpringHill Suites have a good reputation for providing a standard all suite room layout that is clean and efficient. With modern touches, the hotel offers easy access to I-4, International Drive, and the 528 toll road, not to mention you can see SeaWorld which is right across the street. There is a Fairfield Inn & Suites next door that is connected to the SpringHill with a common pool area and snack bar. The rooms have the typical suite layout and offer a nice floor plan with plenty of room for walking - not crowded. The free internet and breakfast is similar to any you will find at a SpringHill across the country. There is a TGI Fridays and CVS within a two minute walk, for added convenience. Overall, the property is a great place to stay when you want to be away from the hustle and bustle of the theme parks, yet only minutes away from the fun. I've never used it, but there is a SeaWorld shuttle bus from the property as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Seaworld Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Munch75
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, Friday 11/11, two queen rooms, adjoining. We requested adjoining, were told it wasn't a guarantee, was thrilled it was available. My parents, my husband & I, our 3.5 year old son and 16 year old nephew were on this trip. If you're able to go to the hotel BEFORE your first day at Seaworld, I would highly recommend it. They will hold your luggage behind the front desk, instead of leaving it in your car if you want. We bought our tickets at our local AAA office, but I think you can buy them at the hotel as well. We got there around 8:00am on Friday, got our Quick Queue passes for the day (they're available in limited quantities). Quick Queues cost $20 per person at Seaworld and allow you to skip the lines on: Manta, Kraken, Wild Artic and Journey to Atlantis; also includes one trip on the paddle boats and the skytower. They print out papers and before you go into Seaworld, you scan them, get cards and on your first ride, you get a wristband for the day. They change the color of the wristbands daily, so it's only good for one day. We did this both days, if we bought them at Seaworld, this would have cost $220 (one day 5 went, the next 6 went). When you get your Quick Queue passes at the hotel, you also get a "discount" card for use at Seaworld. We used it at the Underwater Shark Grill and saved 10% on our lunch (saved us $14). It's only good at the more expensive restaurants and I think a gift shop over $50. We parked at the hotel, and were aiming to take the 8:20am shuttle to Seaworld, but didn't make it. The shuttles leave on time, so we waited for the 9:00am shuttle. I think times vary, so call before you go. The shuttles are big (40ish people sitting/standing), we were expecting a minivan type, so were happy to see it wasn't. Took all of 5 mins to get to Seaworld. Seaworld parking is $14 a day or $20 a day for preferred parking, saving us $28. In the evening the last two shuttles were at 5:30 and 7:00 (again check times for your day). The 5:30 was crowded, as the park closed at 6:00pm. We were in our room by 5:45pm. :) We were looking forward to playing in the pool, but it was too cold for our little one. We went down to the pool grill, got pizza hut pizzas and went back to our room to eat. The personal pans were $5 each, there was also wings, pizza hut pasta dishes, garlic bread and grill foods: hot dog, hamburger, chicken sandwich, etc. The food was fast and yummy. That night we noticed TGI Friday's delivered to your room, but it was too late. The hotel was built in 2009, clean, modern design that we loved from the front lobby and breakfast area to the rooms. We've stayed at many Springhill Suites over the years. We really enjoyed the toilet/sink and shower/sink being separate, especially with my son and nephew in our room. Yes, the sliding door for both rooms has a frosted glass, it didn't bother us at all. The free wired internet was nice. The room had the typical Springhill amenities: flat screen tv, couch, desk, desk chair, microwave, fridge (no freezer section), iron, hair dryer and coffee maker. The big luggage stand over the a/c was nice too. Clock has an iphone charger. Plenty of lighting. Window opens a little with a screen. Breakfast was again typical Springhill style, make your own waffles (blueberry and original on Sat), cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, bagels, muffins, juice, milk, coffee, fresh fruit and something hot. Friday was real eggs, and turkey sausag, Saturday was biscuits and sausage gravy. We again loved the decor for the breakfast area, sheer curtains are used to offer some privacy, plenty of seating and room to move around. There is a Starbucks open in the morning, we didn't need anything there though. We got our Quick queue passes, checked out, got on the shuttle and enjoyed our 2nd day at Seaworld. When we were done, took the shuttle back and left. I would highly recommend this hotel to any family going to Seaworld. We didn't do anything else, just Seaworld. If you're keeping track, we saved $262 plus the cost of breakfast for 6, so easily $300 for two days at Seaworld. The hotel easily paid for itself! Huge kudos to Kim and Steve at the front desk for answering our questions before our trip and making it a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, comfortable & contemporary.”
Reviews.Author: SuncoastFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights 11/3 & 11/4. We were actually going to WDW but wanted to stay near I-Drive. We were very impressed by the layout of the room. Everything was clean and well maintained. Even though the breakfast area was crowded Sat morning the food was fresh and they didn't run out. Real eggs! Rooms were quiet. They share the property with the Fairfield Inn which is more geared for families. TGIFridays and CVS across parking lot. On I-Drive trolley line but far enough away from the convention center to be quiet. Sits right behind Discovery Cove. I've stayed at about a dozen Orlando hotels and I will definitely rerun to this one. My one quibble was that the onsite Starbucks was not open in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location.”
Reviews.Author: tripperATL
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple nights after a cruise, very pleased. ROOM: good size suite with 2 queen beds, desk in between that area and the sofabed. Small fridge, microwave are in the room. Split bath is cool with the toilet, sink in one, then tub/nice shower and large vanity in another room. Really there is room for 2nd toilet in that bath, just be nice for larger family on longer stay. OTHER: big TV, though other SHS sometimes have 2. Sofabed was not comfortable, but then, they rarely are. Ok enough for small, tired kids maybe but not adults. HOTEL: better than average continental breakfast, some hot items too plus the make your own waffles. Decent little pool bar, shared by Fairfield next door, as is pool, hot tub. LOCATION: edge of Sea World property on I drive, a quick dash down to the premium outlets and really, it was a short, easy drive to Disney. Would totally stay again for right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while visiting Discovery Cove, Seaworld!”
Reviews.Author: nijelose
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to both venues and Aquatica. I love the fact that they provide quick Queue to Seworld for free. The hotel is clean with a nice pool for kids to play. Yes we like that they separated the toilet from the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the space for the money”
Reviews.Author: leejay
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night before departing for a cruise. Great deal with the breakfast included and the space in the room. Love the fact that the toilet is separate from the rest of the bathroom (and even with the tiny sink, you could brush your teeth while someone was in the shower). Good location - close to the freeway and the parks. Quiet and safe. What else could we ask for? Staff was nice. They called up about half an hour after we arrived to check that everything was okay. Breakfast was very busy but that was because we went down during the "red" time - busiest as warned by the sign! Bit of a line for things and my only complaint would be having to send my bread through the toaster three times to really get it toasted! And coffee was blah - but you can get some from Starbucks if you're diehard. Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel & value!!!!”
Reviews.Author: redsamp11
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because a) it is part of the Marriott family and b) it was affilliated with SeaWorld. We were not disappointed. The rate was cheap (in my opinion), the hotel was clean, the staff was friendly, the SeaWorld perks were great and the location was perfect. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again if the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: Latonia S
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at this Springhill hotel for business, but it was a great stay. Spacious and clean room. Room smelled nice, fresh, and clean, which is great for someone like me with sinus & allergy issues. Staff was professional and courteous. Breakfast was ok. Overall, I felt comfortable during my stay. And I rarely feel that way about most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room, but check your final bill”
Reviews.Author: ylc25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October. The room is modern and clean. Free WiFi and breakfast. The breakfast was not great, but free. The final bill showed a restaurant charge on the first day that we did not use. Went to the front desk in early in the morning and she said she would ask the manager in 10 minutes. An hour later, a different staff, had no idea about this, but said she would also ask the manager. About 30 minutes later, the manager came out and said he could not do anything until the accountant came in, suppose to be there already, but hadn't shown up yet. We needed to check out and was not in the mood to wait for this. The manager kept saying that our name had to be on the receipt to be charged, but we insisted we did not use the restaurant. Most ridiculous to make us wait for the accountant, obviously we did not use the restaurant to go to all that trouble for $35. The manager should have credited us right away instead of making us wait. He finally did, but we ended up all upset and wasted a lot of time. Poor, poor service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: lovetocruise74
Reviews.Content: My family spent 4 nights here in Sept and were extremely pleased with our stay. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, the facilities were great and location was excellent too. Of particular note was the friendliness of the staff - and I would especially like to mention Andrea who worked in the breakfast area. She was extremely pleasant and friendly and went out of her way to offer advice on our plans for the day. The gym was great- really appreciated it being available 24hours (a good workout is the best jetlag cure!), and our daughter loved the pool area. Breakfast was great. Overall an excellent choice and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cheating on checkout bill”
Reviews.Author: Sleepless2003
Reviews.Content: Normally, I wouldv'e let this go and not commented---but this really pissed me off. I purchased a 2 night stay at the SpringHill Suites in Orlando/Seaworld--it was prepaid through a third party. I overlooked the lack of drainage of the bathtub, and the fact that the key card had to be reset 2 times in my short stay---like when I had to checkout after breakfast and was again locked out. Luckily I had my ID--otherwise I wuld have no way of having the keycard reset. The main issue that pissed me off was the fact that I asked the front desk for a statement or billing--- they said they couldn't because it was through a third party and my balance was ZERO. I just looked at my credit card statement online-- I was charged a fee??? FOR WHAT?? Albeit, not a large fee, but that's not the point. What am I being charged for--I made no purchases during my stay. I was told my balance was ZERO. I was given no paper statement!!!--It's a small enough amount to blow off and not notice per se-- which makes me wonder if this was a mistake or not.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and service”
Reviews.Author: Imbatman
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Springhill Suites while attending a conference in the area. The room met all of my needs and had a internet connection that didn't require a computer degree to figure out. The facility in general is being well kept and up to date. What really makes this place special is the staff. Every encounter I had with a staff member was positive. Each evening I was there, I was warmly greeted by Vinny who I found to be very helpful. The young lady at breakfast was always very welcoming and did a great job of managing the whole breakfast program. I also had some help from Lauran who worked one afternoon at the front desk. I had some items that needed to be shipped via fedex. They didn't have any boxes on hand as it's the customers responsibility to provide one. Lauran went outside her role as a front desk agent and tracked an adequate box for me. She didn't have to do that, but she did and that is ultimately what makes a great hospitality experience. Great job guys, if I'm ever back in the area, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maria r
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel just across from Sea world. Free shuttle to parks and good breakfast. Big rooms, very clean and friendly staff. I can not say enough about this place. This will be my home in my visits to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “I REALLY want to like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: davechri
Reviews.Content: There is so much to like about this hotel. Location - It's great. Just down the road from Sea World. So if you're in Orlando and plan to visit Sea World, it's hard to beat. Breakfast - Wow. One of the best breakfasts (free) I've seen in a hotel. Eggs, sausage, waffles, cereal, muffins, oatmeal, bagels, etc. Really nice. Property - Nice pool. Parking is a little weird, but good. Nice building. Rooms - This is where this hotel shines. Very modern, separate toilet from the shower/sink. (Sink in the toilet as well.) Refrigerator and microwave in the room. Modern style. So why not a higher rating? It was SO LOUD! All night long there were noises outside. I understand the hotel can't do anything about it, but I was surprised that the walls/door did NOTHING to buffer the sound. This was our second stay at this hotel and the first time was flawless. It would have gotten a 4 star rating from me. But after this trip, my wife said "Let's try staying somewhere else next time." Sorry Springhill. I love you, but I can't stay with you anymore.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT MARRIOTT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRoadwarrior
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a few Spring Hill Suites before and have really liked them, and they are usually reasonably priced for what you get. Thought we would try this one near Sea World Orlando. Decided this was nice and close to Sea World so we could walk and save the parking fee for 2 days. Well as it turned out, it was close enough but we were told at the front desk some of the roads had no sidewalks. Fortunately they had a free shuttle service to Sea World that was great. It ran often and only had 3 stops all at close hotels. If fact one of the stops was at the sister hotel Fairfield Inn only a few hundred feet away. While on that subject the SHS and the FI shared the outdoor facilities, pool, pool bath, hot tub, and pool bar. Both hotels looked like they were only a few years old. Nice location on International Drive stretch that is rural and set back from a road quite far so it was quiet. When I booked the SHS on line I asked for, extra pillows, a low floor, and early check in. When we arrived at about 2:30 PM that afternoon the room was ready including our special requests!! Now that’s service. Speaking of service, all the help in the hotel were friendly and said good morning how can I help you? The room itself was the typical SHS two queen beds, divided sitting room with desk, chair couch, frig and microwave, and flat screen TV. One bath has tub/shower and vanity with sink. The other “half bath” had sink and commode. Nice modern décor and very comfortable beds. Nice clean maid service. Room was ready every day when we returned from the park Breakfast was free as usual, eggs, breads, cereal, and lots of fresh fruit, yogurt and good Coffee. In fact for the coffee aficionado there is a Starbucks in the hotel lobby if you don’t like the hotel coffee. The lobby also had three computer stations for public use plus in-room high speed internet and a flaky WIFI system that was difficult to connect to. The pool was very nice, very clean, big, tropical looking, nice music, and nice little area for kids with fountains etc. Nice hot tub also. The exercise room had 1 bike 3 treadmills and 2 elliptical trainers and some free weights. I think all in all for a reasonable price I have to give it at least a 4 ½ star.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe for famalies but not for business”
Reviews.Author: pensman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days for business reasons. As this was the middle of September, I inquired at the desk during check in if we could be on a floor without children. I was assured we could take a room on any floor as there were no children in the hotel as school had started. Let's just say liar, liar, pants on fire. All through the night you could hear children running and the SLAMMING of doors. At breakfast--which I found below par--there were tables filled with children. The hotel is conveniently located to many restaurants on International drive. The rooms are fairly spacious with a sitting area with sofa and desk and a small fridge and microwave are included. The toilet and bath are in separate areas and have an European look to them. I prefer firm mattresses and the ones we had, two queen beds, were pretty well beaten up and way too soft for me. The tv was a large LG that you could rotate for viewing but if you were in bed near the window then viewing was a problem. Our room was clean and well maintained but I will give this place a miss if I need to return to Orlando for business. I am guessing parents with small children are accustomed to their noise and disruptions but if you need a good rest before presenting to a client then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: merelinelars
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with kids (3 and 5 yrs)for 2 nights to visit Aquatica and Seaworld. Front desk was very helpfull to have a room available at 9 AM as we arrived early at this hotel. Shuttle for transfer to Aquatica and Seaworld. Breakfast is good, rooms are spacious (great shower!!).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suites”
Reviews.Author: crlauman
Reviews.Content: Pretty lobby and room. Breakfast was hectic and my only problem with the hote. There was a full house the weekend I was there and the area where you get your food is small. Rooms are quite nice and beds are wonderful. I did walk next door to the Fairview Inn, the sister property, and Springhills lobby was much prettier. It is in the new area of International Drive so there is not alot around the hotel. There is a CVS and FGI Fridays out front which is helpful and the trolley stop is right out front. Oh, and the front desk, especially Lauran, was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Allison R
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at this hotel. Excellent location and added bonus of quick queue passes for Sea World. Few minor problems we had were that the hotel did not cash or allow us to make purchases with travellers cheques so worth ensuring that you have cash. Only hotel i know that does not do this. Most staff very helpful all but one on reception when we checked in and throughout our stay, found her very unpleasant. Lack of umbrellas at poolside a bit of a problem. Also only facility to get a cup of coffee was back in your room after 12 lunch when the lounge bar closed. Rooms were very spacious, clean and modern. Overall a really good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: BillyMcKay
Reviews.Content: Very sharp looking hotel. Suites are spacious (family of 5) and rooms are still relatively new looking. Pool is adequate and I didn't find overcrowding to be a problem. Employees were helpful and easy to get Quick Queue tickets if you wake up early. Breakfast buffet was more than adequate and we never had trouble getting a table, even during rush hours. Convenient to have Pizza Hut to feed kids after swimming - I thought $11 for a medium pizza at a hotel was very reasonable. Front desk was good enough to give us a room with a clear view of Seaworld fireworks (fireworks only in the summer). Can't comment on shuttle - we always drove to Seaworld which was conveniently close. My only complaint would be the useless pullout sofabed - the mattress was so thin that it was better to simply sleep on the couch cushions. Overall, would definitely recommend and we'll probably use it again if we go to Seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: LSP150
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful service, clean rooms, very pleasant staff. The huge breakfast area was always kept clean and the food was always good. The staff that was in charge of the breakfast area was always attentive to everyone's needs. The pool area staff was also fantastic. The pool was large and always clean. The lounge area was also nice. The staff was very helpful when my daughters and I were planning our day. The shuttle that took you to/from Sea World and/or Aquatica was so easy and the driver(s) were very nice and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Five star rating all around hotel”
Reviews.Author: SunGuyMuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and looks like it has been recently renovated. The rooms are roomy with a suite area. What is really nice it that the shower and the toilet are two separate rooms, making it very handy with 4 people in a room. The breakfast area has 2 waffle machines going. There is free shuttle service to SeaWorld. The only down side is that the hotel shares their pool with the Fairfield Inn right next door. We would definitely stay there again. Very lovely hotel for the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fritogator
Reviews.Content: Location was great for Seaworld & Aquatica. Great breakfast buffet before heading to the park. Liked not having to pay to park at the hotel. Rooms were large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, but I'm hesitant to stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Germophobic
Reviews.Content: My family and I resided at the Springhill Suites for 5 nights this summer. It was a very nice hotel, but if we travel to Orlando again we might look into other hotels instead. Why? Since the moment I entered my room I pitied the hotel. According to a front desk clerk it was 2 years old. By the appearance of the room it looked older. There were stains on the carpets and the walls and little marks on all of the appliances. The room was pretty decent, but if you prefer a cleaner and closer-to-perfection type of room this hotel is not for you. If you don’t mind a hotel with stains on the carpets and walls, it’s fine. On this matter, it’s a very kid-friendly hotel. Several families stay here, and there are several loud kids. Definitely not the quietest hotel in the area. The walls were thin and the doors all slammed shut, so it didn’t make for the most restful night of sleep. On the other hand, the beds were very comfortable. It was also an inconvenience that the rooms at this hotel were not wireless. You had to plug into an Ethernet cable and if you wanted wi-fi you could only get it in the lobby. The housekeeping woman did an okay job. She skipped our room one day which really aggravated us. And then the front desk had the nerve to tell us that we probably had our do not disturb sign up when we had never used it. Since we complained, the maid came to clean our room, and it was picked up every night when we came back to the hotel thankfully. Breakfast was good and there was a fairly large variety to fit anyone’s diet out there. The pool was quite pristine and clean, and though it was shared with the neighboring Fairfield it never became too very crowded because of the large size of it. There was a pool-side grill that also served some alcoholic beverages. It also was a Pizza-Hut to go, a smoothie shop etc. Basically there was a lot to choose from! On-site in the lobby there’s a mini Starbucks which was convenient. Also, there was a concierge area run by Expedia. The concierges weren’t the most helpful we’ve ever seen but they did give us advice as to which parks we should go to and got us some pretty nice deals. They do leave pretty early in the day, though, so if you have any questions about dining in the evening, ask in the morning. We were heading out to dinner around 6 or 7 PM and no one was at the concierge area. The service at this hotel overall was alright. The front desk was fairly helpful and kind depending on which shift worker you were dealing with. Some were friendlier than others. The morning cooking staff was amiable and welcoming- probably the kindest people at the hotel. All and all, the hotel was pretty nice and it was in a convenient location on International Drive. There was a free shuttle at various times to Sea World, Aquatica and Discovery Cove that was nice. We’ll probably stay here again in the future, but we definitely will be lowering our expectations. It’s a high traffic hotel so it’s hard to have individual attention as a guest and to have a sparkling room.

Reviews.Title: “planning your first trip to orlando? then get this hotel booked up now!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: paul e
Reviews.Content: Firstly i must say i used trip advisor to help us locate a decent hotel with the facilities we needed as a family for our fourth holiday to orlando. After reading some reviews, both good and bad we decided on the springhill suites at seaworld for two main reasons, the free breakfast and the location. The free breakfast is varied with scrambled eggs, pineapple ham, sausage patties, biscuits ( hot scones to me and you ) make your own hot waffles, toast, basically a good start to the day. The rooms (suites) are very spacious with plenty of room for our family of 5, 2 adults and 3 teens, they were cleaned every day and it seemed that care was taken to do it well, also there is free internet access in each room via ethernet cable, however there is also free to use computers in the hotel lobby. The staff were excellent, i really can not praise their efforts enough, always willing to go the extra mile if they can. There is a pool bar called Splash, next to the pool and the spa, which sells soda's, beer, cocktails, hot food like pizza hut ,chicken tenders all of which is not over priced for a hotel bar, keep your eyes open in the lifts for the infomation sheet telling you everything from the specials of the day, to the weater forcast, to whats for breakfast. Now if this is your first trip to orlando you have not experienced the queue's for the rides, they can be LONG and i mean LONG, up to 75 minutes on some peak days. This hotel has a facility in the lobby( see micheal ) where by if you stay at this hotel you can get unlimited quick queue passes for the day at sea world. So 75 minutes for the manta, kraken, journey to atlantis or the arctic thunder ride becomes about 2 minutes, be aware that these are on a first come first serve basis as there is a limited amount each day. International drive is a big place so if you do decide to rent a car, once you get you bearings this hotel is located right between univeral and disney with easy access to both. Right out side the hotel is TGI fridays and also across central florida parkway is a wendy's and a kfc, also a publix supermarket is a little further up the road. Sea world is right on the door step as is aquatica and you get a free shuttle service to both, saving about $20 a day in parking fee's. This holiday was one of the best we as a family have had and this hotel played a big part in that. Oh one last tip, use google earth before you go and work out the routes around the I drive area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: mel7999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the end of July for 5 nights with our reward points. We did not go to Sea World but did drive to Disney World. Disney is a 10 minute ride which was not bad. The hotel was clean and modern. The suite is nice but there is no wall just a desk with a glass side to it so the kids did not like that in the evening as we were watching tv or reading. The breakfast was nice-bagels,cereal, yogurt and eggs every day. It was never to busy but we did eat before 8 am each day. The pool is nice and has a great area for toddlers and even my six year old enjoyed it. It did get some what loud at this hotel in the evening but we kind of expected it since we usually do stay at the Marriott. The hotel did allow us late check out since we did have a 5 pm flight which was great! My son was able to swim most of the day and not be crabby for the flight home!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Bright & Snappy. Unusually nice and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: paulinkjet
Reviews.Content: Very well maintained property. Rooms are stylishly designed and very comfortable. Front Desk staff is super nice. Continental breakfast a cut above the norm. A great choice in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “It was a perfect stay! All the parks are around this area! Read the last two sentences, for very helpful tips!”
Reviews.Author: PrettyLady4u
Reviews.Content: WOW, I really enjoyed staying here! I never go wrong with stay at the Marriot chains! We are big fans of them. I depend alot of reviews for choosing our hotel and this one here had great reviews. I'm happy I chose it! The suite we stayed in was very spacious and oh so comfy! Breakfast has lots of choices, my favortie the waffles! Get there early, because they start putting it up right at 9:30, although one gentleman was nice enough to allow me to grab a plate and it was right after 9:30! The front desk is very helpful. One little complain that I got from one of our teenagers, is that they don't have WiFi in the rooms. When I asked about it they said that they are working on it, they only have WiFi in the lobby....so teens hung out in the lobby most of the time when we where in the hotel! The Fairfield (right across) has WiFi in the rooms....just in case you really want it. The pool is shared with the Fairfield also. The best part of staying at the hotel was that they offered shuttles to all the parks we went to, so we basically didn't have to drive our vehicles. OH I must mention this too you also, because it's not on there website!! Only one big disappointment for me, was that if you stay at this hotel, they offer you free fast passes for SeaWorld.....well they didn't say that they give them out one day before you go! So basically if you are going on a Tuesday, get your fast passess the day before (Monday!)....get in that line early, because they only have a limited amount. I was not very happy with this,since I was in line at 6:30 am for fast passes that I wanted to use on the same day and they told me I was supposed to pick them up on Sunday. Yes I complained!! Overall we had a perfect stay and I would pick this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Room not ready, front desk not friendly”
Reviews.Author: DaytonaBch
Reviews.Content: We requested early check in. Room still wasn't ready until after 3pm. Beware that Aquatica, Sea World's waterpark, may close as early as 1pm to new guests because of capacity. No clean towels at the pool. Small pool deck, and pool is shared by both the Springhill Suites & Fairfield hotel next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SCSocialgirl
Reviews.Content: A great asset of this hotel is being close to SeaWorld. We bought our tickets in the lobby and received the fast pass on the spot with our purchased tickets. The line was busy in the early morning so we waited later in the day to purchase them and since we didn't go to SeaWorld until the following day, it worked out great for us. We did use the shuttle and it was great. The staff were very friendly and we were glad to have the restaurant outside at the pool area so we could get food late after we had returned from the parks. We did not use the shuttle for Universal bc it only had one return time of 6:30 and we needed more time so we drove there but it wasn't far so it was fine. The rooms are great...the only problem I had with the room was the bigger bathroom did not have a toilet. The toilet was separate in a smaller bathroom with a toilet and sink only. This had some pros and cons with it. They had room to put a toilet in the bigger bathroom and had there been one, I would give the room a perfect 10. The breakfast was good. I liked the fact that I could go down and fix breakfast for the kids and bring it back up to the room. My son enjoyed making his own waffle so he would usually go down with me but we did bring it back to the room most mornings as the breakfast area was so loud and crowded...but expected as the hotel was at full capacity. One great tip for Universal is the single rider lines. We used those and had no trouble getting on rides fairly quickly without spending the extra money on a fast pass. Overall, our experience here was great, loved the attention to detail at the hotel and the cleanliness was awesome. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBurbs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to visit a friend doing business in the area. When she was at work, I relaxed by the pool. This is the first SpringHill I have seen with a Pool Bar, a lounge and a Starbucks! The staff was firendly enough. The breakfast was well stocked. The hotel is new and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodation for the money. Beware the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Gate95
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price. Rooms are very modern and clean. Nice showers. Free ammenities and good location comfortable bed. Friendly front desk and a Starbucks in site. Only issue was the breakfast which is not the highest quality. Millions of people lining up for it... But, I thought that it was a good stay and I'd begin to use the Springhill brand regularly if all stays are as good as this one. I'd never stayed at a Springhill before.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelConqueror
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Sea World, this hotel has a GREAT shuttle service. Also, the hotel was overall clean and had a very kind and an accomadating staff. The outdoor pool was a plus. In addition, the decor of this hotel was awesome- it made you feel like as if you were in the ocean!
