The only little complaint we had was the complimentary breakfast, which was boring after awhile with the same food everyday. Conclusion- this hotel was great and definetly worth your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved Springhill Suites Seaworld!”
Reviews.Author: tuichic
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights at Springhill Seaworld towards the end of May.The location was great-at the quieter end of I Drive,very close to Seaworld and Aquatica.The rooms were a good size-we slept 4 easily.The beds were really comfy and well stocked with plenty of towels and toiletries.The fridge was useful and there was a huge walk in closet. Breakfast was great.We would be nit picking to say otherwise especially since it was complimentary!You could take your pick from cereals,waffles,fruit,yogurt,scrambled eggs,sausage,coffee ....... the list goes on! The majority of staff were very pleasant and helpful with the exception of one girl on reception who was unpleasant. The pool was lovely and fun for the kids.It usually only got busier after approx 4.30pm when people returned from parks. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleo13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasure. The rooms were really big, even a walk in closet. Comfortable beds, great friendly staff. The shower even had wall jets spraying water in addition to the normal overhead showerhead. The breakfast was acceptable, what I would expect from this type of hotel. There is free transportation to acquatica and seaworld which are next door but too far to walk. ALso, the hotel gives out a limited number of fast passes for seaworld if you are at the activities desk early which is a nice bonus. There is a TGI Friday's and CVS in the parking lot which is very convenient. Hotel is also close to Universal about a 15 min drive. Overall, good hotel for a good price, even better than I would expect from a Springhill Suite.

Reviews.Title: “SpringHill Suites at Seaworld was Great!”
Reviews.Author: BradMac
Reviews.Content: We planned a rather last-minute trip to Seaworld when the kids got out of school for summer break. We wanted to stay near Seaworld to avoid long commutes, and SpringHill had a room available. They accepted my AAA membership for the discount when I booked it, and the room as ready when we arrived at 4 pm. The room was spacious, with two queens and couch that would fold out, if needed. I large LCD TV was included. It swiveled to face either the beds or the couch. My only complaint was few channels available to watch with kids. At night, we watched Netflix on the laptop. There was a small fridge, microwave and coffee pot. I did like the the shower being in a separate room from the toilet. Each room had it's own sink. The shower also had additional sprayers, which the kids loved. The staff was always friendly, and the room staff palced my daughter's stuffed animals in different positions everytime they cleaned the room. She couldn't wait to get back each evening to see what they had done this time! Starbucks in the lobby was my second home! We'll stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable reasonably priced accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Kathyclownfish46
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights to be near Seaworld and Discovery Cove. The location was perfect! The hotel is fairly new and the stairways still had that new carpet smell. Employees were super friendly and really helpful. Lobby is really cute with a seaworld theme. Rooms were large. We especially loved having 2 bathrooms in the suite. One bathroom has a sink and shower, the other has a sink and a toilet. This was very convenient for our group of 3 women! Loved having TGIF Fridays right in front of the hotel. Only drawnback was that the pullout couch had a very thin mattress, I mean really thin. My 21 yr old daughter ended up sleeping with me becauset the pullout was really bad. it would probably be okay for small children.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice...Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: TPoppleton
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night after our cruise and before our flight home but it was very nice. It was clean and had a small fridge and microwave. The pool was a nice size and looked like lots of fun for kids. My daughter certainly enjoyed it. The breakfast buffet lacked meat (bacon, sausages) but one can survive without them for a day. I definitely would stay there again. Fantastic location if going to Sea World (right across the street) and even for Disney it isn't a far drive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: theherberts04
Reviews.Content: Springhill Suites ideal base for 2 day visit to SeaWorld 1) Rooms and public spaces clean and well equipped 2) Breakfast ample and great start to day 3) 5 minutes to SeaWorld by free and friendly shuttle 4) Quick Queqe passes worth the price of hotel - No wait for roller coasters and Atlantis

Reviews.Title: “Free breakfast,Early admission to Seaworld didn't work out”
Reviews.Author: b626Iowa
Reviews.Content: On the morning that we had an early admission to Seaworld due to staying at SpringHill Suites the front staffer knew nothing of it till she rifled up some papers on the front desk and read it for herself.This was around 6:30am. We had just seen it that early morning in the room TV on the 'SeaWorld' channel. This would be an 8 o'clock entry for a regular 9am opening at Seaworld. We then went upstairs to try to get kids up.The handout we recieved the previous nite before showed 8:20am as being the earliest free shuttle to the park so we resigned ourselves to driving the car and paying parking just to get there early. We went downstairs to eat the free breakfast(pretty good!) and a new staffer had showed up at the front desk. I asked her what was going on with the early entrance to Seaworld and the shuttle schedule. Low and behold this gal informed me a early shuttle was specially scheduled to leave in about 5 minutes! Which our family was not ready for! So we drove to Seaworld but the Seaworld help never showed up to let car traffic in till more like 8:15. Try to drag as much park and shuttle related info out of the staff the nite before. Early morning of that day is not the best time to do it. Also on Sunday morning we had to be at the airport by 7:30 but on that Sunday the hotel would not bring out food until 7am.Because it was Easter? I hope this doesn't happen every Sunday. We had to leave before then so the whole free breafast thing was pretty much shot to heck. And yes the airport was pretty darn busy. If you have an early flight don't always count on a free hot breakfast from SpringHill Suites. The pool area is very nice-shared with Fairfield Inn next door. Poolside Bar & PizzaHut for munchies. TGIF within walking distance. Unfortunately the baby area of the pool is not separated from the adult side. Pool was shut down for hours on our Saturday evening there because someone made a #2 in the pool. Even when it was OK'd to swim in after the chlorine doubleshock sunk in who would want to jump in? The room was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal if you plan to visit Sea World parks”
Reviews.Author: chatty_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our spring break here our boys, ages 6 and 9. The staff was friendly and helpful. We did a variety of amusment parks including Sea World, Aquatica, WDW and the Kennedy Space center. This location is very convenient to everything and there is a CVS right next door where we picked up water and other sundry items. The boys really enjoyed the pool. The hotel has a partnership with SeaWorld and we got free Quick Queue wristbands for SeaWorld (normally costs $24.99 per person) This allows you to get to the front of the line on rides and to ride the Sky Tower for free. Very handy considering how crowded it was. The hotel looks new, and the rooms were decent and clean although I can't say whether it will stay this way with the large amount of school groups staying there. There was a couch cushion on the elevator one evening and it looks like someone tried to transport a bowl of milk and cereal on the elevator one morning. The breakfast was okay, but extremely crowded. They had canned fruit and make your own waffles. The huge amount of disposable plastic and styrofoam at breakfast was a bit dismaying and I'm hoping that Marriott will consider switching to more eco-friendly alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat for the $$”
Reviews.Author: HinghamPonch
Reviews.Content: Modern rooms with big TV, comfy bed, nice pool area with bar and cheap drinks AND FREE BREAKFAST every morning, all for about half what you'll pay at the Ritz 2 miles away. Felt really good about my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: sumidara
Reviews.Content: Left the Hard Rock Hotel to be close to Seaworld. Well worth the money just by getting ahead of the line passes for Seaworld just by staying there. Very clean, friendly staff and located near stores, restaurants and parks. Internet in room easy to connect to even though it isn't WiFi and great breakfast. Absolutely met all our needs and for a very reasonable price. Thought any hotel after the Hard Rock would be a let down, but we really enjoyed ending our vacation here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrbrent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites Sea World for four days in March. The entire stay was fantastic! From the moment we checked in until the moment we (sadly) left, the hotel staff was top notch! Every staff member we came in contact with was very friendly and made us feel welcome. The staff members at breakfast were especially helpful! Our room was clean and provided plenty of space for our family of four. The breakfast served was great! The hotel is located close to Sea World and the hotel provides a shuttle to the park. We also found it very convenient to other Orlando attractions. We added an unexpected Disney visit and the drive was very easy. It is also close to many restaurants. Our kids loved the pool Although it is shared with the hotel, next door, it was never crowded. It has a great Shamu splash zone. Overall, our visit was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and easy on the pockets!”
Reviews.Author: nupe954
Reviews.Content: Having lived in Orlando for about 10 years me and fiance have frequented hotels on the tourist side of town for "staycations" and this one does not disappoint. Rooms were very clean and moderately spacious. If you are visiting Sea World it is literally diagonally across the street (but I would still recommend driving). From what I understand the hotel underwent some recent upgrades and anyone staying there will get the same relaxed and comfortable feeling as soon as you step in the lobby. Only negative comment is the staff should be trained more on the marriott rewards program, it was a hassle to get them to understand but the manager cleared it up.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressive whatsoever”
Reviews.Author: SeekTheBest
Reviews.Content: We travel a LOT and have had our fair share of really great hotels and others which were really bad. Springhill Suites at Seaworld was kind of on the low end of the middle range. The lobby is nice enough, they have a small circular area which is surrounded by long draping curtains, it makes it look a bit elegant. One of the reasons we went with this hotel is the Starbucks located right in the lobby, however we found it wasn't staffed all the time. We arrived to check in around 6pm and there was no Starbucks staff in sight. That's fine, I basically wanted my espresso in the morning and hotel coffee just doesn't cut it. So, we arrived at our room, it's not really a suite. It does have a couch and chair and between the bed and the couch is a little desk built into a wall. I wouldn't exactly call it 2 rooms, it was one room with a dividing wall. The little round pillow on the bed was stained with what I hope was simply food. Otherwise, I'd have to say the room was fairly clean. There was only decaf coffee, although as noted above, there was a Starbucks in the lobby. Saturday morning we left for the Convention Center and we returned about 6pm...our room had never been cleaned. We had not left any "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door and had not left instructions with the desk or housekeeping, so why our room wasn't cleaned, I really can't figure out. I showered and as I was sitting on the edge of the bed in my bathrobe, housekeeping knocked on the door looking to make up the room. At 6:30pm!! The hotel is not that big, they obviously either don't have enough staff, or their housekeeping staff is totally disorganized. You can hear the toilet in the room above you flush. The bathroom is split into 2 rooms, the shower was a nice size and in a room with a counter and sink and the toilet was in a small room next to it, with a tiny little sink. The "free" breakfast consisted of reconstituted egg powder and sausage gravy and biscuits. Not the healthiest of options, but can you complain if it's free? Not that we used it, but the swimming pool is shared with another hotel, also in the Marriott brand. Would I return to this hotel again? Most likely not, as Orlando is filled with hotels and this was much farther from the Convention Center than advertised. We thought it was in walking distance at .8 miles, but it was actually almost 2 miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherri_annie
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The rooms are huge and comfortable and quiet. Did not hear any noise from the adjoining rooms. Only thing I heard was kids running up and down the hall occasionally. But it is Orlando, that is to be expected. The breakfast was better than most hotels. I loved the way the lobby and breakfast area was designed. Lots of comfortable seating. All of the staff were very nice and attentive. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again - great customer service and nice large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jaggsmith
Reviews.Content: Very nice, clean, modern hotel with extra large room. We had 2 teens and our room had 2 queen beds and a nice big pullout couch. It was also very convenient having 2 washrooms (one toilet). The staff was very friendly and helpful especially the early morning breakfast staff - they were awesome! So friendly and always making sure you had everything you needed. The complimentary buffet breakfast was "tops" - delicious and a great variety. The hotel is conveniently located off the main corridor and close to Sea World. The only down side is if you are planning on doing Disney World, you will have to pay to take a shuttle there and back every day which was $8 per person, and the shuttle times are not the most convenient - either early morning (which is fine if you want to be there when the gates open) but then the next one isn't until 10:45 am. Other than the shuttle, the hotel was wonderful! Nice pool area as well (although we didn't use it because it was too cccccold when we were there :)

Reviews.Title: “Laptop stolen!!!”
Reviews.Author: nothappyinspringhill
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend February 18-20th for my sons birthday. We checked out the morning of the 20th and went to Seaworld. We were just about home we realized we had left our laptop hidden between the night table and wall. As of this time, it is cannot be located by the hotel staff. We had to go back to Orlando (almost 2 hrs) and fill out a police report. Either hotel employees or the current occupants of the room have the laptop. We feel hopeless to do anything. All of my sons videos/photos are on this computer. That is something you cannot put a price on! I am hoping it will "turn up" in the next day or so.

Reviews.Title: “I've never been to a better hotel.”
Reviews.Author: c0dewarri0r
Reviews.Content: Wow, I was very surprised at the quality of the hotel. Everything is still very new and modern. The pool was awesome for young kids and the gym was very well equipped. Rooms were quite large and well decorated with a very nice TV that could be positioned to be seen from the bed or seating area. The staff were courteous and helpful making a few arrangements for us. Starbucks in the lobby was nice and pizza hut express by the pool came in handy. Could have used some healthier food options. We will stay here again if we are ever in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cool room -- weird bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: lilac11wine
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here as part of a long weekend in January. Overall, clean and new. Very nifty and efficient room design: compact fridge and microwave; nice lounge couch and desk; TV placed between living and sleeping areas. Bed was not comfortable. HVAC unit was loud -- I thought it was a truck. Bathroom was just plain weird. Sliding glass door to toilet/sink room was at the base of the bed, which made for very little privacy. Shower/sink room (also with a glass sliding door) was a bit better -- the extra shower jets were a pleasant surprise. Hotel is across the street from SeaWorld and has a CVS and a TGI Friday's in the parking lot. A clean place for great value, if you can deal with the weird bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to everyone...can't rate this hotel highly enough!”
Reviews.Author: Louise_987
Reviews.Content: I'm probably the pickiest person I know when it comes to hotels, (I find fault with even minor things, much to my poor husband's horror) but I can honestly say I couldn't fault this hotel at all. The room we had was a great size for 2 adults and a 4 year old, and would have accommodated another child perfectly, even 2 more at a push. The rooms were fantastically maintained...spotlessly clean and serviced brilliantly each day. I loved that there was a full size fridge in the kitchenette, which we filled with supplies from the supermarket which was about 5 mins drive away. You could even order room service from the TGI Fridays which was just a minute walk across the car park, which was great after a busy day at the parks. The breakfast area was a little crowded at times, but there was never an occasion when a table wasn't available. The staff were more than happy for breakfast to be taken away to be eaten in your room. The laundry facilities on each floor were also great. Entry was gained by swiping your room card, so I felt safe leaving my items in the machine while I went back to my room. .$1 for a box of soap from reception and another $1 to use the machine, and the load was ready in about 30 mins...brilliant! The location of the hotel was great...really easy to get to Disney, and it really is a stones throw from Sea World. You could even hear the screams from people on the rides when you stood in the car park. Reception were so helpful..we went to a few of the malls and outlet parks, and each time reception happily printed off directions from the hotel for us. Can't rave about this hotel enough...wish we were going back again this year.

Reviews.Title: “great clean and modern!”
Reviews.Author: dutchlove
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my 22 year old daughter for 4 days away from the cold. We LOVED this hotel. Bright clean and modern hotel. Great rooms kind of "Japanese decor" feel to it. Lime green and light blues everywhere. The beds were compfy and clean. Nice little living area with desk with internet connection(free) available. Seperate Toilet. And a microwave, coffe maker and fridge completed the room. Nice pool area. Do count on bringing some drinks because the pool bar doesn't open until 5 during the week. But there is a Fridays next to the Hotel. We also enjoyed a great Japanese restaurant next to the hotel and there is a supermarket nearby and a cvs right in front of the hotel. The pool area is nice and there is a big hot tub. All in all I will certainly stay here again when I'm back in Orlando. It's not a "resort" style hotel but VERY nice.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: cappuccino-babies
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spotlessly clean and all staff in the hotel from reception staff, cleaners and waiting satff were all welcoming polite and happy to help. The room was very comfortable with 2 double beds and a selection of hard and soft pillows for your comfort. The room had a massive TV and lots of channels to watch. The Breakfast was fantastic you can make your own walfles and there is a good selection of muffins eggs, cerals and drinks. The Hotel is situated between all the main attrations, which made it easy to travel inbetween all the parks. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel which takes you up and down International drive. On site of the hotel is TGI fridays and there are a selection of restaurants all of which are very good. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Service... skip the Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Mildmanneredreporter
Reviews.Content: Good clean rooms, big beds, no bedbugs... great location (CVS next door if you forgot something). Walking distance to Seaworld and Aquatica (hotel shuttle runs twice a day). The buffet is not very good... but there is Starbucks coffee for an extra charge. $40 round trip via taxi to Disney or Universal, just beware the unlicensed taxi drivers... they are ever present at this hotel. Overall.. we'd recommend it if you are going to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Property.... services not quite up to par.”
Reviews.Author: PalmBeachBuckeye
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 and my brother-in law's family of 3 stayed at this property on 12-24 thru 12-26-2010. The property is very well maintained (aboyt a year old) and is connected to another Marriott property that shares a common bar, outdoor food area (serving pizza, burgers, etc), a pool and splash area, and a workout facility. The check-in was a bit wierd as they have a very space-age type set-up in the lobby with a round service desk that is awkward for conducting business when other guests are standing there. My room was not ready when we arrived so I was upgraded a bit to a handicap access room that was a little larger than the room we had booked with 2 queen beds and a pullout couch. The Room itself was clean and had a great view of seaworld (as requested). There was a nice flatscreen TV that was on a swivel and the ability to plug in an external DVD Player (great for the kids). The bathrrom was very strange as they had the shower/tub in one half bathroom with a sliding plexilglass door (not good for when people are asleep and light shines from the bathroom) and the toilet in anther half bathroom with a plexiglass sliding door. I guess they figured 2 people could use the seperate bathroom facilities easier, but trust me it was a little awkward if you had to use the bathroom after taking a shower and going between doors. The A/C was rattiling when we got to the room and the maintainance worker came up in about 10 minutes and installed a new A/C unit inside of 20 minutes. Great service, but I really think that should have been checked and replace prior to guest being in the room. That evening I had to make 2 seperate trips down to the front desk for bath-towels and sheets for the pullout couch. We did not discover either of these had been missing until returning home from dinner and a night out. We were unable to shower or put the kids to bed for an additiional 45 mins. The Breakfast area was just not laid out well at all. They did have a nice selection of foods, but the lines got crazy and the flow of traffic right thru table seating areas is just not well thought out. The staff at the front desk, breakfast area, bar, and concerige desk were some of the nicest and friendliest I have encountered and they geuinely try to make the guests feel welcome and help them. Most are very good at remembering names (impressive). Overall, I was happy as I booked this at a local special price of $82/nite for a room with 2 queen beds, a pullout sofa, free breakfast, and right across the street from Seaworld with a Friday's restaurant right in the parking lot. I would say that the property tries to do entirely too much and should focus more on avoiding the chaos at breakfast and straightening up the housekeeping issues. I would stay here again if I was able to get a good rate again.

Reviews.Title: “Much nicer than you would think- new hotel”
Reviews.Author: soccermom32082
Reviews.Content: For the price, you can't beat this place. Very close to Seaworld. It was new, clean, modern. Very nice spacious room with flat screen, mini fridge, free breakfast. I liked the bathroom configuration - the toilet and a small sink were in one room and the shower and another sink in another room. That is nice when one person is showering, others can still use the restroom. Only negative would be that the breakfast was packed with people and also no wireless in the room - only hard wire. There is wireless in the lobby. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Mike49389
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, location and value. Only downside was the crowded lobby that made it very difficult to find tables to eat breakfast at.

Reviews.Title: “If you're going to Seaworld and like a lot of space, STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: travelesquegirl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because we planned an after Thanksgiving trip to Seaworld for November 26-28, 2010. The hotel is right next to Seaworld and walking distance to businesses such as CVS, TGIFriday's and KFC. We checked in on Friday evening and was pleased to find that the hotel was at the non-congested end of International Drive. When we got to our room, we were pleased that it had a clean, fresh scent and a clean, fresh look...something that I always look for in a hotel room. The two glasses next to the coffee pot were covered with a paper covering. I uncovered one of the glasses only to find it dirty with juice pulp and and lip stains. The biggest advantage this suite has over many other 3 star hotels in Orlando is the layout of the suite. On each side of the WALK-IN closet, there is a bathroom. One side has a bathroom with a toilet, sink, and mirror...the other side has a bathroom with a huge shower stall with glass doors, a large sink, and large mirror. The shower has multiple shower heads with VERY STRONG WATER PRESSURE. There is one hand-held shower head mounted on the wall, one shower head sprayed water above my head, and then there were two more valves that sprayed water directly into my face. The pool and outdoor music was great. The breakfast was free.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jerry7722
Reviews.Content: After reviewing just about all the possible places to stay in Orlando for our Thanksgiving vacation, we decided SpringHill Suites at Seaworld was the best selection for our needs. My wife and 25-year-old son arrived quite late as our flight touched down at MCO about 10 PM. Our rental at Dollar was waiting and off we went for the short drive to the hotel. The receptionist had our reservations in order, which were 2 rooms that were adjacent and connecting in a quiet area of the hotel. One was a King for my son and the other, 2 Queens for my wife and I. The rooms were both spotless and offered no surprises. Each had a small fridge and microwave. The room with 2 queens appeared a bit larger with a small walk-in closet. and a bath/shower combo while the King had a large stall shower and no tub. The closet in the King was an armoire type wardrobe with 2 drawers. Smallish capacity but adequate for our son. The rooms were located at the end of the hallway away from the elevators and most foot traffic so we always had a pleasant night's sleep during our 5-night stay. Since a basketball team was staying in the hotel and later a group of teenagers, this proved to be an ideal location for us. We used one of the hotel's 3 computers on a daily basis. There was always one available for our use and it worked in a proficient manner. We never took advantage of the hotel's free breakfast buffet as we always slept rather late. The hotel is very close to SeaWorld but not much else except a TGIF's and a CVS 24-hour Drugstore, both of which are just a minute's walk away. We always parked in the rear of the hotel as this was near to a card-coded entrance door which was very close to the hotel's 2 elevators. We found the staff to be very friendly and gave us excellent directions to any and all places we wished to visit. The weather during our stay was excellent. In the low to mid-80's every day and low 60's at night. There was only a spurt of thundershowers one late afternoon that lasted about 45 minutes. We did visit Disney World, Epcot, and Adventure Island at Universal, along with a quick stop at Ripley's and a magic show at Wonder Works on International Drive. Shopping consisted of a stop at the Florida Mall and a high end Premium Outlet discount mall plus the usual souvenirs at the amusement parks. We dined at Del Frisco's for steaks, Roy's for Hawaiian fare, Antonio's for Italian and had lunch one day at TGIF. We had 2 breakfasts during out stay. One at a Denny's across the street from the hotel and one at the coffee shop in the Peabody Hotel where we also had our Thanksgiving brunch buffet. All in all, a very pleasant vacation. We found SpringHill at SeaWorld in Orlando to be most relaxing, quiet, and comfortable. This is what we look for when staying in a hotel and SpringHill did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: traveldave99
Reviews.Content: On a 5 trip, we have been awakened 3 of the 4 nights we've been here by other loud guests. Two nights this happened between 11pm and midnight and this last time at 4am!!! If this is the quality of guests who stay here, then be prepared! You will lose sleep! Pay more money and stay at a quality hotel!

Reviews.Title: “If only housekeeping did a better job...”
Reviews.Author: mykidsm0m
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel, the folks at the front desk, and the breakfast. However, we stayed there four nights and half of the time our room was only partially cleaned/serviced. Paper products were allowed to run out and the bathroom (low-flow toilets...need I say more?) was not thoroughly cleaned. We did receive the paper products after calling to request them, but I expected this, and the bathroom cleaning, would be done as part of the normal housekeeping process.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: TxTrvlr88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights during a conference and found the hotel to be first rate. Very quiet and clean, and every member of the staff was very professional and friendly. The one area that I believe fell short was the breakfast ... styrofoam plates and plastic utensils surprised me, and the limited selection of breakfast items was disappointing. I've stayed at other Spring Hill Suitues where the breakfast choices were more extensive and the setting was more comfortable. Overall, though, this facility does a very nice job. It is very attractive for families, but the presence of large numbers of children did not present any problems whatsoever in terms of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: lindaataaa
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on a AAA Familiarization trip and was so surprised when we toured this hotel and the adjoining Fairfield Inn. What beautiful properties. There was everything you needed right there at the hotel. Great activities for the kids. Also nice eating place right at the pool and a bar with adult beverages also. Very nice, and comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids, lovely and clean”
Reviews.Author: AliJohnstone
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as nearest to seaworld and aquatica and was a good deal but was so surprised rooms are spacious great bathrooms, clean throughout with a bar open till 11pm. free breakfast and great freindly staff! What more could you ask for. Could definately stay here for 7 days no worries. I am an ex travel agent and am always sceptical of standards until actually arrive. Made great choice this time and will return next time in Orando.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: kdiddi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is kept very clean, and it is so comfortable. The breakfast is amazing, but it gets very crowded so go early. They seem to have alot of large bus groups that stay at this hotel. But overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: gpdrn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because I had problems checking in next door at the Fairfield. The hotel has a nice in appearance and is only a year old, however there were problems. The carpet in my room was stained and torn. The lighting in the bathroom with the shower is terrible. There is a second bathroom with just the toilet and sink which make using the bathroom confusing. Changing channels on the TV was very, very slow and not all the channels worked. The ice machine was broken. The AC thermostat did not work my room was freezing and I could not turn down the temperature. There is a very small half-depth refrigerator in the room and tiny microwave but no sink or counter space to go along with this. The pool was very nice but is shared by the Springhill and the Fairfield. I can imaging that this gets very full in peak times. Also the breakfast was adequate, however there is very limited seating - I really hate to think of being here in the Summer or other peak times. I would not recommend this property. The Springill at LBV is older but nicer, with a better room layout, larger breakfast area seating, and staff that is better trained.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: danygurl
Reviews.Content: New, modern and nicely decorated hotel. Very polite staff (good housekeeping and hospitality)! Spacious rooms with sofa bed, large desk, 2 phones, microwave and mini fridge. (awesome plasma, easily accessible tv for plug in electronics), Plasma has 11 HD channels, HBO and 6 sports channels. No balcony. It can be noisy at times (slamming doors; during day and people checking out at 5am). Pool, fitness room, lounge, bars ect and hot tub are shared with with Fairfield Inn. Across street from SeaWorld, and fast and easy 10 minute drive to Universal easy access to interstate). TGI Fridays and 24 hour drug store (CVS) within 500 feet. Hot continental breakfast has a wide selection to chose from (scrambled eggs, sausage pattys, waffle makers, oatmeat, cereal, bread, bagels, english muffins, blueberry muffins, juice, coffee, tea, milk. The pool is ideal for families and small children. Pool towels, breakfast and wireless highspeed internet (lite) are complementry. Nice safe area outside of downtown core but still close. Pizza hut, poolside bar, lounge bar and starbucks onsite. Parking is free. All in all would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pepperdusty
Reviews.Content: Really close to Seaworld, Aquatica and Discovery Cove! Nice breakfast buffet (fruit, yoghurt, waffles, danish, muffins, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, juices), large rooms and super comfortable beds. Shuttle service to Seaworld and Aquatica. Separated bathroom with sliding doors. Stayed there for 5 nights and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for kids”
Reviews.Author: Kal_C
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for kids. The rooms are spacious and we were able to get a room with two beds and the pullout couch is nice for the 3rd child to sleep on. The breakfast was nice with several choices but very crowded and the kitchen could not keep up with replenishing the food fast enough. The kitchen did keep putting food out for the customers in line even though the hours of the breakfast had ended. The pool was very nice with a zero entry level, built in water toys and plenty of chairs. There is also an outdoor area to order pizza and drinks. There is an indoor coffee shop which converts to an evening bar and also serves food. Overall it is a nice hotel, the rooms were clean, there was a laundry facility on our floor, and was fine for a few days while visiting Sea World. I would stay here again and would definitely stay at another Springhill Suites for the spacious room that can accomodate a family of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: shaniz1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night before checking into Disney. We checked in around 5 pm and the room was not ready. We had to wait about 20 minutes, but the clerk gave us a $20 credit for the trouble. The rooms are nice sized and have good furnishings. The place is obviously popular with student tour groups as we had trouble with them making lots of noise all night. We had to call the front desk at one point to ask them to be quiet. It is a great location as it is next to Sea World and Aquatica. The breakfast was good and they had plenty of seating available. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: BVoyager
Reviews.Content: This place is just great from the beginning to the end! I would notice all new design touch in US hotel industry; easy check-in/out; great breakfast; no extra charges for parking, shuttle or TV usage; hotel stuff easy to deal with; reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “comfort”
Reviews.Author: memoajojo
Reviews.Content: althought this hotel is not close to all the attraction. it is very clsoe to sea world . The hotel is amazing and the rooms are so comfortable. Breakfast was usually the same every morning but it was better than nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is DAMP. No window insulation. Kids running around. EW!”
Reviews.Author: bayhills
Reviews.Content: I am a Floridian so I am very used to humidity. But our room was very damp... and everything in it was damp, including our clothes and the bed linens. There is a retaining pond out front and the LOCUSTS kept us up all night. Their buzzing was unbelievable. We were two adults there for a weekend getaway and I would NOT recommend this hotel if you're not bringing your kids. There were kids everwhere... in bathing suits in the lobby, in the elevator... everywhere. Speaking of the elevator, it is carpeted and it is also WET all the time from aformentioned bathing suit-clad KIDS, so the elevator smelled very, very bad! I was pretty grossed-out by the hotel. Yes the decor was boutique hotel-like and modern in style. But don't be fooled - it is a budget-friendly chain hotel at the core. Our room did not have a bathtub either. Don't know if that was all rooms or just ours. And don't get me started on the noise from the TGI Friday's in the parking lot, which is more like a night club. Anyway, if you want to be close to SeaWorld, are bringing your kids and your ear plugs and dehumidifer and want to get what you pay for, this hotel is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Impressive at Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ritzytaste
Reviews.Content: I am the pickiest hotel shopper. I will spend hours looking for classy spacious rooms at the best price possible; important since I have 3 kids from 11 and under. I have lived in FL most of my life and been to Orlando more than a handful of times. This hotel was fantastic. The decor was beautiful--design you'd find at the finest of hotels. When we walked into our room (on the 6th floor) our mouths dropped. We could not believe how spacious the room was. Everything was meticulous, streamlined and calming yet cheery. There was a microwave and fridge, too. The pool area was more than ideal for our children who entertained themselves for over 2 hours in the beach entry and with the penguin statues and water features, while we enjoyed $5 (or less) drink specials from the poolside grill and bar. Breakfast was plentiful. Great eggs, sausage, belgium waffles, fruit, etc. The hotel appears exactly as featured on the website and even nicer in person.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: peach92
Reviews.Content: We stayed May 31 - June 4, 2010. Very modern decor - loved it! Friendly staff. Splash Zone area in the pool was fun for the kids. Hot tub area was nice. The shuttle from the hotel to SeaWorld was convenient. The hotel breakfast was good. Had a great time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant value”
Reviews.Author: sunshineShropshire
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had a deal where we had 5 nights for the price of 3 PLUS unlimited access to Seaworld and Aquatica for the duration of our stay. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are large - esp as there was just the 2 of us. The seating area was a great bonus. I can see how people would get a bit bored with the breakfast if staying for any length of time bit, in my experience, all of the 'free' breakfasts fall into the same category. The pool area is more than adequate & considering it is used for both hotels we never had more than a few other people there at the same time during the day - it did get busier at night when people got back from the parks tho'. Towels are available to use at the pool free of charge - a real bonus on checing out day as you dont have to worry about wet towels in your luggage for the trip home!!! The bar offers deals on beer & food. We shared a pizza a couple of times for about $6 inc a soft drink & breadsticks. We walked to Aquatica but there isnt a walkway & the bushes are a bit thick in places so wouldnt advise walking if you have young children. We got the shuttle bus to Seaworld & the trolley bus back. All the staff were pleasant & helpful - we arrived early for our check-in & were given a courtesy card to use the facilities. As soon as a room was available ( about 10mins) they let us check in. Overall, I would highly reccomend this hotel & would definately use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: Liann
Reviews.Content: I apologize in advance for the big review, but for those like me, details are good :) THE HOTEL Booked SpringHill Suites based on the reviews and at $500 CDN for airfare and accommodations for 5 nights through Expedia.ca it was an amazing deal. Our flight arrived late (12:30am) and Expedia notified the hotel of our late arrival. Check in was quick and easy. The hotel was built last July and still smells new. The modern decor gives it a boutique hotel feel. The room was, for a nice change, exactly like the photos on the hotel's website. Sure, the room could sleep five people (two queen beds and a sofa), and the split bathroom (shower/tub and sink in one, toilet and sink in the other) makes it easy for people to get ready, but for just the two of us we felt spoiled with all the space! The closet is almost large enough to be used as a bedroom (lol). Large flat screen tv can be turned around for either the sitting area or the bed area. Our complaints are very small ones - it would be nice to have a full length mirror and extra hooks in the bathrooms for towels. The toiletries, while nice smelling, weren't topped up - but I'm sure if we asked the maids we would have had no problem getting more. Oh, and the air conditioning is a little noisy, but earplugs take care of that. I'm sensitive to noise and while I could hear people in the hall during the day it wasn't very often, and I didn't hear anything at all during the night from our neighbours. Breakfast was a nice start to the day. Selections of cereals, yogurt, fruit, biscuits, pastries, scrambled eggs, sausage, juices, coffee and even waffles if you're up for it. The dining area is lovely and modern with its shiny glass tiles and we never had a problem finding a seat (we ate anywhere between 7:30 and 9:30 am). Internet is free in the lobby and I didn't have any trouble getting one of the three computers. It helps that the hotel put a sign up limiting your time to 15 minutes, although if no one is waiting then you can use it longer. The staff were super nice and there is an Expedia concierge on site (you will have a message on your room telephone the morning after you arrive). The hotel is right near Sea World - our sunset view of a roller coaster was cool - and provides a courtesy shuttle to Sea World which I highly recommend because while it looks like a short walk could quickly turn into a very, very long one when the heat is 31 celsius (88F) at 7:00am. They have several return trips that give you lots of time to enjoy the beautiful park. For those heading to Disney the shuttle is only $8US. There is a TGI Fridays a short walk from the hotel, a bank, grocery store, and CVs a short drive around the corner from the hotel. THE HEAT Ah yes, the heat. We were in Orlando from May 20 - 24 and the heat was, from what the locals say, just starting. The temperatures quickly got up to 37 celsius (98F) and I found water didn't cut it. Gatorade was more on the menu. Drink lots of water the night before if you can. I spoke to quite a few locals and they say there are some who adjust to the heat, but for most they never get used to it. Did I mention the humidity? We're talking pretty much 100% humidity ... without rain. Supposedly ladies don't sweat, they perspire. Not so in Orlando. I don't mean to get too personal, but ladies you will "prespire" in areas you didn't think could do that. Drink lots of fluids, and don't forget your hat or your vacation could turn into bed rest with heat stroke. Obviously sun block is a must. We used Hawaiian Tropic Sheer Touch Lotion Sunscreen SPF 50. I have super fair skin and didn't burn at all (or tan for that matter). My friend used it on her face and didn't have a reaction. It has a nice cocunutty-summer smell that didn't change to that chemical smell common for most sunblocks. We drank lots of fluids, kept to the shaded areas when possible, and had a fantastic time. CAR RENTAL We decided to rent a car. Looked into public transportation and decided a car rental was more efficient and given the heat we're glad we did. The I-Ride can be somewhat unpredictable, and the bus routes called for walking-bus-walking-bus-walking to get to places like Universal Studios. The roads are clearly labeled and we had absolutely no trouble getting around. Be warned though ... it seems the majority of drivers don't signal when changing lanes and they come up on your hind end pretty close sometimes. There are a couple of tolls from the airport, but they don't cost much ($1 and then $.75) and the roads are lovely (probably because they don't need to deal with, dare I say it, snow and ice). For car lovers ... or those who get bored on the road ... I noticed that there seemed to be a number of Mustangs in the area and so we made a game of counting them. In a 2.5 hour trip we counted 52 Mustangs! New Cameros and Corvettes are popular too. We rented from Budget (read a few bad reviews about overcharging at Dollar and Thrifty that made me a little nervous) and our pick up at the early hours was quick and painless. Within minutes we were off in our shiny, electric blue Toyota Corolla with a sporty little tail fin. The cars aren't marked as rentals so you look like a local (good for those worried about potential car break ins). The car did have some marks on it which I took photos of ... just in case. SEA WORLD Sea World was our favourite. For $109US we purchased the combo ticket for Sea World and Busch Gardens (you have 14 days to use the ticket). It's cheaper to do the combo or you will pay $78.95US just for Sea World and $74.95US for Busch Gardens. When you enter the park they scan your ticket, and your finger. We got there early and were able to do the rides first thing - front seat, screaming, adrenaline pumping good fun. Rides aren't just for kids ... we're in our 40s and LOVED it! Watched the killer whale show, the sea lion show, dolphin show, and an acrobatic show. All great. Yes, the killer whale show is short, mostly videos and borders the commercial, but cool just the same. Couldn't help but laugh at the sea lions and the actors. The dolphin/whale show was enhanced with acrobats and beautiful birds flying overhead. We touched the silky surfaces of manta rays while others held shrimp between their fingers to feed them. There is lots of shade and some of the venues are air conditioned which is helpful when you feel a tad overwarm (trust me, you will). Sure, the drinks are a little costly, but where we live a bottle of water can cost $3 CDN at the theatre so the prices weren't as shocking to us. We had a hand carved turkey sandwich with super fresh bread and potatoe salad at the air conditioned deli for about $10 (we shared the sandwich because it was so big). BUSH GARDENS Went to Busch Gardens in Tampa. Was about an hour drive each way and the roads are clearly marked. A trolley takes guests from the parking lot to the park. I recommend going early because it get hot and don't forget your hat. The temperature was the same as the day we went to Sea World, but for some reason it was close to unbearable the day we went to Busch Gardens. There is a fair number of shaded areas, but the walkways are not as wide which may be why it felt hotter. Again, your ticket is scanned and your finger is scanned. We did the Endangered Species Safari for $39US and loved it. This group is a little smaller than the regular safari, and a little longer, plus you get a bottle of water. Unfortunately we didn't get to see the rare black rhino, Forrest (he didn't want to come out of his air conditioned cave, go figure), but we fed giraffes chilled lettuce (absolutely cool), saw white rhinos, zebras, rare antelope (can't remember what they are called) and more. The keepers and guides were great and answered all of the questions. Highly recommended. As for the rides, unfortunately the Sheikra ride was down for a bit and when we got back to it the wait was just over an hour. Too hot for that. Sure, we could have bought fast passes, but there were only three rides we were interested in and the Montu was good enough to scratch the roller coaster itch. Had lunch at the Crown Colony Restaurant (mainly because I was feeling more like a microwave from the heat and the restaurant is air conditioned). Don't let the table service scare you off if you are budget conscious - I had the grilled vegetables for only $10. My friend had the albacore tuna salad for about $10 and I could barely see her over the mound of goodies on her plate (tuna, olives, veggies etc.). Plus, you can see the animals in the seregenti area. Around 5:00 the temperature became bearable, but only because the sun was starting to set, and we were able to check out more of Busch Gardens in a little more comfort. COCOA BEACH We drove along the coast and checked out Cocoa Beach, about an hour from Orlando. We could have eated at one of the many fast food places, but wanted to be spoiled with table service and found this great Italian place called Branos Italian Grill. For $10US I had a delicious pasta with lovely bread. Our server recommended Jetty Park near the cruise ships. She said it's neat to see the cruise ships depart around 4:30pm. It costs $10 to park (cheaper during the week) and you can spend a great day at the beach. It was surprising to see surfers mixing with swimmers and fishermen. Yes, you can fish on the beach .. where people swim! We walked down the pier and had a nice chat with some local gentleman fishing who were happy to show us their catch of the day. There were a lot of people fishing on the pier so watch out for fish hooks and keep your shoes on. SHOPPING We didn't do much shopping. Checked out the nearby Florida Mall. What can I say, it's a mall. But I can't say enough about Ross Dress for Less. It's sort of like a Winners (or TJ Max), but cheaper. I couldn't resist the 350 thread count Egyptian cotton queen deep pocket sheets for $22US (probably $70CDN at Winners), and a pair of Steve Madden heels for $12US. If I had the room in my suitcase I would have brought home a queen chocolate brown stripped sateen comforter and oversize pillow shams for $19US and chair covers for $4US. OUTTA CONTROL COMEDY CLUB DINNER I can't say enough good things about this place. For $25 you get all the salad, pizza, beer, wine, soft drinks you can eat. But it's not about the food (really, it's not ... the food is edible but nothing special). It's about the show and what a show it was. Tony Brent had us laughing so much my sides hurt. The show is child friendly, but adults will love it too. It's also interactive and you can't help but laugh at the way people behave on stage. He also performed magic, and I do mean "magic." I have no idea how he did what he did. We didn't reserve our tickets, but given the reviews online you may need to soon. The room is small and seats people at four long tables. Definitely a MUST SEE while in Orlando. OVERALL All in all, I definitely recommend this hotel if you're heading to Orlando and all the sun and fun that the area has to offer. But don't forget your hat!

Reviews.Title: “Heart stoppingly beautiful”
Reviews.Author: la_solitaria
Reviews.Content: OK. This is hands down my favorite place I have ever stayed at. I love the style & decor. It is new & the style ultra contemporary with lots of pastels. I am such a girl, I know it. This is so my kind of place. Staff were all lovely & very helpful. The maintenance were even very friendly, making sure that I enjoyed my stay and would be coming back again as I was on my way out. This is the way it should be! Loved the room layout, though the double bay bathrooms is a little weird, but I could see how it would work for multiple people traveling together. Huge closet space. I could practically live here. Only thing that could make this better is having beds as plush & modern as the room. Breakfast was great! They had my scrambled eggs & they were cooked perfectly & not too greasy. Kudos to the team at this hotel, they do a fantastic job.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: victom
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. It's new and very close to Sea World and Discovery Cove. The only thing I thought that could be improved was the elevator being too slow. Would love to stay here again! Not a lot of activity around the area so it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, would stay there again, most helpful and friendly employees of anywhere I have ever stayed!!!”
Reviews.Author: tony20fan
Reviews.Content: Great location for Sea World and Aquatica, though to far to walk. Front desk employees were the best. Rooms are lovely, very roomy, the chaise on the sectional a great touch, internet worked great, pool area beautiful, nice breakfast, very clean. Wish every hotel I stay at was like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a clean, new hotel right next to Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Lacrossian
Reviews.Content: We checked in for 16 nights Apr 4th - 20th 2010 at a cost of 1,976 USD, which makes this stay great value indeed (keep in mind one of the two weeks we stayed was the dreaded Easter week). To put that in perspective, Disney resorts were in the 4000 usd range for the lesser ones, and Universal ones were at 300 bucks per night. As you can tell I'm writing this review while still staying at the hotel, 9 days in our trip. The hotel is clean, and spanking new. It's part of a two-hotel complex owned by Marriott so it shares its swimming pool, fitness centre and other amenities with the Fairfield Inn. To be clear, if you want to stay in that area, you need to compare the rates for the two hotels as the two are identical in style and size. And by identical, I mean really, really identical. Don't be caught paying more to stay in either - go for whichever has the lower rate. In terms of style you're looking at a modern, utilitarian style seen in places like Premier Inn. Think clean, simple, very generic. I like it that way personally. This is true about the entire hotel except for the pool which has a nice splash zone zone for the little ones and a nearby jacuzzi. The pool however is smaller than the pictures found in the Marriott marketing materials. In terms of service this is were the 'utilitarian' style sort of fall on its own sword. The staff is slim, bareboned almost. They are courteous but don't expect them to get out of their routine to go and give you a great experience, this isn't the Waldorf Astoria. They will however try to promptly accommodate your requests if you have one. Breakfast is complimentary but very repetitive and basic. It's perfectly fine for a short stay but after 9 days my wife and kids are already asking for another option. Rooms are clean however I wished they had been kept that way a little bit better during our stay. I had to complain the room hadn't been vacuumed and the tissue box hadn't been refilled. My request was taken into account and the staff did check to see if it had been covered, however it simply shouldn't have happened in the first place. The mini fridge and microwave provided are convenient however the sitting area barely doubles up as a dining area. Don't expect to sit your kids and eat with plates and cutlery. That area of the room is more appropriate to much on sandwiches or takeaway burgers. The rooms, called 'suites' are bright, spacious and the sofa doubles up as a bed so you can sleep 5. I wouldn't recommend staying with anyone but family though as it's not THAT spacious and the walls of the toilet are paper thin, hint hint, nudge nudge. Odds and ends: The bathroom has a bath and a sink, it's functional like everything else. You also have a second, 'mini' sink in the toilet, as well as a storage area which is convenient to store your suitcases alongside your clothes. A set of 3 drawers and a little storage area below the TV is barely enough to hold the clothes for a family of 4. The TV is HD, but the cable service quality is patchy (expect compression artefacts and grain). Channels provided are the usual HBO, CNN , ESPN etc. There is a laundry room with washer dryer which is worth mentioning as it's quite useful. Location wise I didn't have a car so walkable venues were my #1 priorities. To be clear YES you can walk to Seaworld but it takes 30 minutes if you walk fast, and aren't afraid of not having a walkway at times. I did it with my 10 and 14 yo kids but it wasn't comfortable and regretted not getting a cab. Both Aquatica and Discovery Cove are walkable easily without hassle. Restaurants: TGI friday, A thai, a japanese, a kfc, mac donald, wendies are all in walking distance. We did some light shopping at a nearby Publix convenience store. There's also the usual assortment of CVS pharmacies and 'junk food' stores and gaz station forecourts. That's not bad but it's not great either. Keep in mind were you are, this isn't downtown San Francisco. We often wished we had a car. Universal had to be done by cab and we aren't looking forward to the LYNX bus for Disney. The hotel shuttle is USELESS and the IRide, even though it stops right in front of the hotel, only comes every 20 minutes. Florida mall is 30 bucks each way! It's possible to enjoy all the parks without a car but don't expect it to be perfectly seamless. Sleep quality is excellent. There is no sound inside or outside the hotel and the beds are really comfy. Conclusion: I would definitely stay there again or at the adjacent Fairfield Inn, with or without a car. Yes the hotel was basic but then again at this price expectations have to be realistic. Springhill suites is a clean, pleasant hotel ideal for business traveller and young families alike. This however NOT a luxury or 'soulful' venue and you will need to be assertive should a 'mistake' occur during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: mayshyme
Reviews.Content: I loved the cleanliness of this hotel! The pool was heated to a perfect temperature. Sheets were clean and crisp. Friendly staff always willing to give directions to local restaurants, etc. The poolside restaurant was a bit pricey, but friendly staff. What a clever idea to seperate the toilet from the shower so two people can get changed at once. Kids loved the ice cream in spongebob shapes sold by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janet K
Reviews.Content: We all joined the hotel very much. The room and bathroom were clean and they made every good use of space. We arrived at about 1am and called for extra sheets and blanket and they were deliver in less then 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Plane21
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The location was perfect as we were bouncing back and forth between SeaWorld and Disney. We were traveling with 2 children and the 'suite' arrangement was excellent. The breakfast was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: fr002yu
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, comfortable and good location. Just across from seaworld, around the corner are lots of restaurants (thai, italian, japanese, american and fast food) and a supermarket. Quiet location, and great staff to meet you at the counter. free breakfast is convenient(nothing fancy).

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite”
Reviews.Author: homerdome
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with all aspects of my stay. The location was perfect as we were bouncing back and forth between SeaWorld and Disney. There are plenty of restaurants and things to do. The rooms were very clean and beautiful. We had three rooms with three parties and everyone's first reaction was that the rooms were 'soothing'. We were traveling with 2 children and the 'suite' arrangement was excellent for corralling the kids and for setting up a Pac and Play. This allowed our youngest to sleep while we were able to watch TV - a priveledge not available in a regular setup. The breakfast was okay, but nothing to write home about - standard hotel fare. The pool/bar area was a nice feature as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheSmys5
Reviews.Content: I took my two college age boys and their girlfriends to the Orlando area. Since I wasn't with my husband and third son I didn't want to go overboard on price. I got a AAA rate of $59 per night. Whenever you get an unbelievable rate you assume you are getting what you pay for. NOT SO in this case. I was pleasantly surprised that everything was wonderful. It would have been wonderful for $150! The room lent itself to a little added privacy. There was a partition between the pull out couch bed and other beds. The bathroom is split up to accommodate more people getting ready at the same time. Tub/vanity in one area and then toilet /corner sink in another area. Both closed off by sliding doors. That was great!! Mini-fridge and microwave also had shelves above to accommodate our snacks. The room was VERY clean! We got extra towels, blanket (since it was below freezing outside during our visit), etc... Had a problem with TV = which ended up being an "operator" problem (hee hee) but a repair person was pronto to my room to help and it was 7pm!!!! The only tiny negative I could say is that the breakfast was very crowded an hour before closing - BUT that isn't the hotels fault - they actually warn you of that with a small sign at the front desk. I just went earlier the next morning. And if you do sleep late and hit the crowded time - they still put out food until the very end! :-) The Concierge desk attendant was VERY knowledgeable and very kind. He looked up some info online and printed it out about manatee encounters in different areas. I was there when the shuttle driver came in to see where his riders were. The attendant said, "we are going to give them 5 more minutes". I thought that was nice. My teenagers got in the hot tub (weather being 29degrees outside) it was great! All in all - everything was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS A WINNER”
Reviews.Author: PJG2224
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my aged parents and our two children, aged 9 and 12. The rooms were spotless, beds are new, beautifully decorated. All was new. No problems for breakfast, full, tasty. Great value for families, right beside Seaworld. KFC, Wendys, Publix, Thai restaurant, Gas Station and Pharmacy right around the corner. Can sleep up to 5 people in one room. Great design, bath area seperate from toilet area so more than one person can use facilities at a time. Good little gym (open 24hrs) with basic Lifestyle treadmills and ellipticals, heated pool with children play area and small Starbucks cafe located inside hotel (however open only until noon). Free internet and free breakfast for about $110 for a family of four (AAA discount). Recommended for families, handicapped travellers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied but not thrilled...”
Reviews.Author: marilyn3205
Reviews.Content: Travel days December 31, 2009 - January 2, 2010 At first glance the Springhill is very pretty... reminds me of a luxury hotel on South Beach Florida. Everyone is very nice and professional. The view of the rollercoasters on Sea World are nice and it's great to have a Friday's Restaurant in the parking lot. However... the downside (when traveling with kids) there are vertually NO chanels on TV for kids. One of the things we look forward to when we come to Orlando is watching the things to do at the attractions and cartoons. The only TV stations were the cartoon network (an analog chanel and looked really bad) and Nick. Nothing Disney... possibly the hotel has a contract or deal with sea World. The mirror in the bathroom has a really pretty circular design but, for a 5'2 person it's a little uncomfertable to blow dry my hair with the design in the way. There is a Starbucks in the lobby but they close at noon and only have hot and iced coffee NO frappuccino's :0( If you're coming for New Years ask for a room with a view of Sea World they have AWSOME fireworks at midnight! All in all we had a nice stay. You should always enjoy the times you have with your family but, I think I would only return here if I can't find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - not happy afterwards”
Reviews.Author: Javisdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sprinhill Suites. It was a new hotel and wonderfully decorated. The rooms were big and looked great. We had no problems during our stay. The staff was nice and some even took pride in remembering your name. The free breakfast was a zoo, but I was warned by other trip advisor writers, so I knew to avoid it. Ruby Tuesdays is in the parking lot, and they deliver. My main issue was that we left our laptop in the room by accident when we checked out. We didn't realize it until a day later. I was very surprised that the hotel didn't call me, given that I was a Marriot rewards member and that they had all my information. I had to call and was given an answering machine. I kept calling back until I talked to a human being. I was able to get my computer and my mom (a local) picked it up and shipped it to me. I'm still surprised the hotel didn't call me. I guess one of the things you lose with the cheaper price is service. My wife reminded me it was right before the Christmas rush, but I figure if you want me to stay there again, I should have gotten more urgent and immediate service when I left an important item behind. We did like our stay and it was very close to Sea World. Not close enough to walk, but very central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wonderful staff, BUT bad housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: SuperTul
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Seaworld package of buy 3 get 2 nights free. We chose this place because it's relatively new. Overall we were quite happy with our stay even though we were not happy with their housekeeping at all. We checked in around 7 pm, and got a room on 6th floor (we were asked for our preference whether we wanted high fl or lower fl). Check-in was smooth and fast. But when I got to the room, it was not clean at all. It looked like someone was still in there or it wasn't been done after guests checking out. I first thought I got in a wrong room! So I had to go back and ask for a new room. That was not a good way to start our stay. After we got into another room, I realized that there was only a walk-in shower, no bath tub. So I went back to ask if I could get a new room with a bathtub because it's more convenient for a two-year old. The staff was very nice and helpful. She gave us an accessible King-bed room on 5th floor. Room is very spacious. Bathroom and restroom are huge. We like the layout and decor very much. Have to say that it's not spotless. There were some stain and dusty spots throughout. Bed is nice but bedding sheets are not as comfortable as what we just had at Comfort Suites airport (sorry, can't help comparing). One nice thing though is that we didn't hear any noise from next doors or hall way at all during our stay. Breakfast was nice. Plenty of food and seating. Food is the same everyday though. We didn't have problem of over crowded during breakfast time like in other reviews. Maybe because the hotel was only about half full. However, our last day, which was Halloween, breakfast was a lot more crowded than previous days, but still no problem getting food or finding seats. One problem about their breakfast is that one (out of three) waffle machine was not working properly throughout our stay, then on last day, another one was broken too. Business center with 3 computers and free printing was good. Internet connection in our room was very slow though. Shuttle service (through 3rd party) to Seaworld parks is free and pretty good. We used it only once because we spent most of our time at Disney. We didn't use their shuttle service to Disney because it would have cost us (2 adults+1 child) more than Disney parking fee, and it has very limited schedule. Staff are very nice and very accommodating. We requested for a late check-out since our flight was late evening, and got 2 pm check-out without extra charge. Here comes the part we didn't like about this hotel, and this is why I couldn't give higher rating. Housekeeping was bad. Day 2, one trash can wasn't empty. Day 4, One trash can was left without a bag and empty tissue boxes were not replaced. Day 5, our room was left open when we came back at 8 pm! One of facial soap bars we got had moldy stain. We reported this to the front desk and got some apology. Overall is good. I'd recommend this place to others in the next 6 months but not sure if we would return though with housekeeping service they have.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: TicoLee
Reviews.Content: We were pleasant surprised by this property. It's located directly accross from Seaworld, and we had a nice view of the park from our 6th floor room. The room was very clean andlaid out well. Staff was friendly and the complimentary hot breakfast was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “The best experience $59/night can buy!”
Reviews.Author: IcedWrist304
Reviews.Content: Partner and I stayed from September 24-27 vacationing from Chicago area. Hotel staff provided excellent customer service, very clean, and safe. Room was large, trendy, and extremely comfortable. *******IMPORTANT***********Upon arrival, pizza menus where under our door, which I thought was great. I called STEFANO'S Pizza, biggest mistake ever!! Flyer stated best pizza and fastest service. Gentleman explained pizza would arrive in about 1 hr. After 1 hr 10 minutes, still hadnt arrived so I called. Stated driver was on his way. 10 minutes later, the driver calls my cell from his cell phone, explaining he had been pulled over and on his way. After a brief altercation in lobby, and $5 off my pizza and fries, I went up to my room at 4am to eat COLD, SOGGY pizza. Never again!! The next night, there were 3 more flyers under our door. ALSO:::::There was a message on phone regarding Discount Disney tickets. Don't fall for it, two guys working were very cocky marketers who tried to rip us off. They charge more for tickets than if you just buy at the park. Very rude and try to con you into time share rentals. SpringHill should keep a better eye on the the deceptive business practices of cross promoting companies located on their property. I will absolutley stay again, only this time I will not deal with the outrageous behavior of the businesses listed above.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pick”
Reviews.Author: mastcfw
Reviews.Content: Very new and very nice hotel. Staff is friendly. Same basic free breakfast but staff was more than accomodating. Housekeeping staff is great and the Marriott.com had a summer special rate for 59.00 per night. Best 59.00 spent on a hotel in Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...close and great Seaworld Package!”
Reviews.Author: tber
Reviews.Content: We were heading to Disney for a week to stay at our Disney timeshare but decided to leave a day early and see Seaworld for the first time with our 6 year old son. I had a nearby Hilton booked and then started looking into the Seaworld ticket prices and found that Marriott partners with them. The tickets alone (best price anywhere) for the 3 of us would have been ove $190. The room at any nearby hotel- $85. We got length of stay tickets and a new modern room for less than $180. This is abarnd new location VERY close to the entrance of Seaworld. It is right next door to the Fairfield Inn and they share a pool. There is a also aTGIF resturant within walking distance in the parking lot. This is a very new, sparkling clean hotel. The check in staff as excellent. We arrived at noon, well before a room was ready but they were happy to give us the Seaworld passes so we could enjoy the afternoon at the park. The package provided a Shamu stuffed toy for my son ($8.99 at the park) and upgrade to premium parking. They may have had a shuttle but we preferred to have our rental with us. The rooms were VERY clean and modern. We had a pullout bed which was perfect for my son and rest of the room was spacious. Perfect for the business traveler as well. I will complain that the only downfall is with cool glass doors to the bathroom and shower, when you flick the light on to use the bathroom(s), the entire room was lit up. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was excellent..cereals, waffles and eggs - all the basics nicely presented. We were there at prime time but no waits and lots of tables available. Between this and the no parking fee, it just made it a best bet for one night. We saw lots of families enjoying the pool but we did not get a chance to see it up close. My final verdict was that this was a GREAT fit to our needs for one night. For a week, with a family in tow - the Seaworld package is a great deal but we may have been on top of each other in the room after a week. We have had a chance to stay at one more of these SpringHill suites and they are a nice Marriott branded hotel. For location, CLEANLINESS and Seaworld amenities, cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and New, but ...”
Reviews.Author: debbiejo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and it is very nice and modern. The room and bathroom were both clean. I ended up with a room with 2 queens which seemed larger than the king I had originally reserved. I don't know if that is the case for all of the king rooms or just the corner one I was first given. The hotel is very close to Seaworld if that is one of your choices of parks to visit. The staff was very nice and polite. They were helpful with directions etc. Now, my few negative remarks. The breakfast area is very small and really is crowded when the hotel is full. It was not a pleasant experience. Although the pool is very nice, it is shared with the Fairfield Inn next door. I imagine it could be quite busy there if both hotels were full. I think the fitness center was also shared, although it was very nice and was not overly busy when I was there. Finally, there are 3 computers, but they are very slow. It's very frustrating to use them. The rate I got was very good and I would possibly stay there again depending on which season I went.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!!”
Reviews.Author: Karyn01
Reviews.Content: All in all, we had a terrific stay @ Springhill Suites. The staff was very accommodating. However, I not sure this is a kid friendly hotel. Contemporary style but lacks space. The breakfast bar really needs to be expanded. This would definitely be my hotel of choice if ever visiting Orlando again.

HotelInfo.Name: SpringHill Suites Orlando at Seaworld
HotelInfo.Address: 10801 International Drive, Orlando, FL 32821
